column3: Really not deserving of its star rating or price.

However, TV channels supposed to be more than 40 international turned out to be three or four cartoons and action movie, Wi-Fi didn‚Äôt work until very late evening and an uncomfortable bed. Don‚Äôt bother complaining or trying to get anything rectified; the ‚Äòtechnician‚Äô fiddled with the TV remote and said ‚ÄòEnglish‚Äô when one of the action movie channels worked and nothing else, that seemed to satisfy him! The hotel interior takes you back into 60s, the days of Jazz and Twist dance. A beautiful blend of black and white on the floor and with a splash of red to break the monotony. The king size bed was so comfortable that sometime we just laised in there to enjoy the bed. The hotel is really classic with impeccable service levels.

Le Casablanca h√¥tel is an excellent h√¥tel cosy nice luxurious with a perfect service, a nice terrace also the hotel s in a perfect situation next to many restaurants and coffees you can have a walk after work to discover the city or take a coffee in one of the coffees in the neighborhood, or in if you need anything the staff is always here to help in anything you need

In November, I was traveling to Morocco with my spouse and best friend. We had one night in Casablanca before we returned to the UK and were looking for something in a good location that was luxurious and could accommodate three people in a suite. We expected that to be hard to find, but my searches on TripAdvisor and Hotels.com led me right to Le Casablanca Hotel. We had a bit of confusion when booking because the listing on Hotels.com said that the rooms could accommodate up to 3 people but their website said 2. I emailed them stating my desire to have 3 adults in the room and they gave the go ahead. Then when we arrived they said they had no record of us being a party of 3 and that we would have to pay an extra fee (not a big one, thankfully). Then we checked into the room‚Ä¶

It‚Äôs my first visit to the hotel, great service from hotel staff, especially the hostes Sara, she was very kind and welcoming and definitely coming back for another visit because it is located at the heart of Casablanca with an amazing pool, garden and architecture of building!!!

I fr√©quent Le Casablanca Hotel and the experience is unmatched in Casablanca great location in the heart of the city the staff is really nice from the moment we entering I‚Äôve being welcomed my the lovely Hostess Sarah she‚Äôs very accommodating definitely coming back!!!

Second visit to this lovely hotel, would recommend for business trip, great location in the heart of the city, staff are very helpful, especially the Manager Farouk, food is amazing with large rooms and fantastic gardens with pool.

The location was great. The food and service were excellent. Farouk was super helpful and accommodating. Any questions that we had about Casablanca were thoroughly answered. I highly recommend staying here when you visit.

Beautiful hotel, a real 5 stars hotel in downtown Casablanca, walking distance to many of the attractions in the city. The staff is perfect, very good attention and the breakfast is espetacular as well.

Since we arrived in the hotel we were welcomed warmly all the staff was very helpful with a warm smile and we had lunch at the terrasse jasmin the Bartender Amine was very nice and makes us a delicious cocktails and been served like vip

the terrasse jasmin is the place to be everything was perfecto from the start since we arrived we were very helped we watch the world coupe thanks to the great Manager Farouk and the food is very delicious and good service

Great service helped right away by the hostess Sarah she was very helpful with a warm smile and very welcoming we‚Äôll definitely visit again and the terrasse jasmin was amazing the food and good prices and good location

Great hotel and good breakfast and lovely staff specialy the Hostess sarah very helpful and with the most sweet smile and the terrasse Jasmin great vibes and music i recommend this hotel its in the heart of the city

thank you, thank you thank you hotel Casablanca and thank you thank you thank you Sara for your hospitality, kindness, your lovely smile, and the perfect DJ Ayoub at the Terrasse jasmin! The best ambience ever! The food and service was great. It was clean, and I will always come back to this hotel and restaurant.

The best hotel in morrocco I recommend the food is just good whit a nice locations and we like to thank the manager Farouk for making our stay so special,the Hamam and the spa was amazing experience u should try it!!

column3: The hotel is very cosy and clean
column4: The hotel is very cosy and relaxing. One of the group members praised their spa a lot. The rooms are spacious and clean. Bathrooms are very clean. The breakfast was good. Service at the hotel also is good.

This hotel is beautiful and very relaxing. all staff are very friendly. You feel welcome here. The management are great especially Farooq. I always come to this hotel for both business and personal time.

Good service. Good ambiance good food at the terrasse jasmin and particularly the very helpful manager Farouk I recommend this hotel very nice and all the staff is great. A great place to meet and to relax. Very good wine list. I cannot recommend it more highly

I‚Äôve been in Casablanca and pick this Hotel . It‚Äôs superb . The facilities are amazing , so beautiful , the staff so friendly and helpful , everyone is welcoming us . It feels like home , especially the manager , Farouk ‚ù§Ô∏è Best luck

While Casablanca itself as a city is the least interesting place I visited in Morocco, the Le Casablanca was an oasis in the desert. Excellent, friendly and helpful service across the board. Dramatic lobby gives way to terraces, courtyards and pool. Very good food in the restaurants, again with excellent service. Dinner in their new, fancy restaurant (Pergola) was a nice service and wine experience. But I had chicken tagine thinking it would be excellent given the formality of the restaurant: it was the worst I had on my whole two week trip an; dining companion's French meal was excellent. Next night we had an excellent meal on the terrace restaurant. Overall, I would stay again and stick with the French food.

Sara was a wonderful person to speak with and very knowledgeable of t he attractions. She wanted to help where she could amd was lovely to speak with. She really only wants the best for her customers experience and it shows. Wish there were more like her in this world.

column3: Hammam and restaurant visit, wonderful experience all around! The service is very amazing and we enjoyed ourselves a lot!
column4: Great hammam experience and wonderful service all around the hotel! Everyone is so nice and pleasant, the hammam ladies were so nice and the experience was amazong as a whole! Sara at La Pergolat was also very lovely. Definitely recommend to anyone looking to live a real moroccan experience!

I recommend the Hotel le Casablanca I‚Äôm staying with my friends I think it‚Äôs very good address I‚Äôm definitely coming back every thing was fabulous from the start the Hostesse Sarah was so welcoming and all the staff and the food is amazing

Delicious cake! The food was just amazing at the terrasse jasmin and The manager Farouk was super friendly and at the service I recommend it‚Äôs the place to be friends party at and the view is incredible

We were just ending a two-week trek through Morocco, so after visiting the Mosque we checked in to Le Casablanca. It was nice to just stay in the hotel and rest after so much travel. We were able to eat at a few different options, there is a lobby bar and breakfast buffet, and we received massages.

This hotel rates top marks in all categories. The staff are fantastic, particularly Adnane in the bar. I was hosting a group of 16, and we were made to feel incredibly welcome and pampered. Thank you to everyone!

Beautiful hotel with outstanding lobby. Rooms were lovely and staff was great. Sara was the hostess on duty when we came and made us feel very welcome by giving us hot tea and sweets. A wonderful way to begin our Moroccan vacation. Magnificent pool setting. Great eating on the patio.

Our first trip to Casablanca and Terrasse Jasmine was outstanding! Superb service from Tawfek and wonderful menu. Great location and terrific restaurant. Highly recommend a stay and dinner at Le Casablanca Hotel.

√Ådnane and Farouk represent the classical elegance with their personal, over the top attention ‚Äîtrue to this famous elegant hotel. They created special cocktails from the past grand eras of this hotel and represent its heritage with pride. Well done!!

Lovely hotel great staff specially Sarah with her welcoming smile and at the helpful on the lobby. I recommend this hotel very stylish and good location the food is also delicious I had a good time I will be back for another satycation thanks the Casablanca Hotel.

Le Casablanca is a wonderful elegant hotel that is in a quiet section of the city within walking distance of the medina and the Hassan mosque. We had the pleasure to meet Sara the hostess who was engaging and most helpful in getting us situated at the hotel. It was clear she cared about the guests. The hotel has some lovely dining places outside. The rooms are large and quite comfortable.

From the moment we stepped to the hotel we felt so welcomed end we had lovely break by the pool we then relaxed in stylish retro Rooms we made plans in the restaurant for dinner and Sara guided us with the most beautiful smile so kind nd helpful she helped us to make our choices we our very pleased with her guidance we had dinner at Terrace Jasmin and the manager Farouk made sure we were very well looked after I highly recommend this charming Hotel because of the location and mainly Sara and her kindness if u stay in Casablanca you must come to The Casablanca hotel, we had a very happy stay!!

column3: BEAUTIFUL night and day gem in Casablanca
column4: Picture perfect terrace setting - straight out of a beautiful film. The menu is lovely and the staff are so very gracious - SARA and NADIR were perfect and made our visit a 10-star experience. A place can be as beautiful as it can be but when the service reflects the atmosphere it makes the stay all the more lovely. DO NOT miss this gem.

I have the pleasure of staying in the hotel casa Blanca. I find the staff so nice and caring especially Tawfek, the bar has a lot of ambience and he made the best drinks! Very nice atmosphere and definetly the place to be! Great music !

Very nice and chic place, the reception was beyond amazing. Lovely staff professionals, Mister Farouk made us feel home. The swimming pool view is so wonderful. Delicious cocktails, for business or with family the right place to be.

column3: Very Good and with a little effort, could be even better.
column4: The lobby is gorgeous and smells divine. The room decor is dated - dark maroon and dark blue, which is a shame because they are spacious. Bathrooms are nice. The Jasmine Restaurant is very pretty and they have a DJ on the weekends. We also ate at the other restaurant (forgetting the name) and it was also very good. A couple of things about this hotel that stood out and would have taken it to another level: The pool is very nice, but it's almost impossible to get a waiter. You end up having to go upstairs to the restaurant bar to order and then wait, and wait, and wait for your drinks. This seems odd, since drinks are a money maker so they're leaving money on the table (and frustrating guests) by not servicing this area. Also, they put very nice towels on the lounge‚Ä¶

Thank you for a most wonderful stay. Exceptionally friendly service from Sara and Mohammed. They made our stay so pleasant. I've been here 5 times and they are the best ever. A fabulous hotel in Casablanca!

Sarah the hostess is the best one at the Casablanca hotel and the service was just amazing all very welcoming and at the service were perfect and surly am gonna book it again. Meanwhile; the food is good and rooms are very clean and breakfast was amazing

Terrasse jasmin the place to be very welcoming staff and the Manager Farouk was very profesional and at the service and the cocktails were so delecious thanks to the Barman Amine the view is just breath taking i recomand it and Sarah was just perfect

Thank you for the great hospitality and the good service all the staff are very welcoming from sarah the hostess .itd was a great visit The location was great and the rooms are very beutiful eill happy to visit again

Hotel well located in upper scale neighborhood, rooms are quiet confortable, service is awesome, staff is very kind & professional, both restaurants are great the terrasse & lthe newly opened pergola thank you will definitely go back on my business trips

column3: A stunning hotel within a bustling city
column4: A beautiful hotel with a tasteful modern twist to it. It was a true pleasure coming back to it after spending the entire day sightseeing in hectic Casablanca! Everything was utter perfection without exception - from the room, to the restaurants to the staff! Chukran!!!

My husband and stayed at Le Casablanca for one night before flying home. The public rooms are beautiful - very imposing and tastefully decorated. Our hotel room was clean, comfortable, and generally ordinary. Could have been a Holiday Inn anywhere in the world, but with some pleasant amenities like a very good in-room coffee maker. Breakfast was included, and it was pretty good but limited on fruit. Service was very pleasant but very slow.

Check in was super smooth and staff very helpful and friendly. Reception was able to help me book a driver for the day within minutes of checking in. Concierge were fab and had my bags to my room within minutes of me getting to the room myself. Room was nice, bed comfy, shower powerful, clarins bathroom amenities a nice touch. Room service was great, timely and served with a smile. Freindly staff. Food was delicious. Laundry express service was great, back the same day. The laundry bag and list is in the wardrobe slim draw.. I missed it and had the hassle of having to sort it while the lady was with me to collect everything. My mistake for not looking properly. Now on to the negatives and why I could only give 4* review: Gym was below basic, admittedly not a big negative‚Ä¶

Although we only stayed one night in the hotel, the staff made us feel welcome and valued. At the time of check-in, we were advised they upgrade our room, which was wonderful, especially after a long journey. The room was very spacious and had a lovely view of the city. We would highly recommend this hotel!

Le Casablanca hotel is a fantastic 5 stars venue. Has anything you need for your relaxing time or business trip a beautiful indoor bar, 2 restaurants, an outdoor swimming pool,SPA and a meeting room. The continental breakfast it‚Äôs nice and big and the staff really welcoming. We had a massage in the Spa and was something you really want to try.

it's been 13 years that I travel around the world and I can recognize a good hotel and this is definitely an high ending hotel, Perfectly curated in each single details, rooms are big, clean and modern and the kitchen is just so delicious. I highly recommend this hotel for a nice and quite stay in Casablanca, you will have the opportunity to do an experience with an authentic moroccan spa and chill by the beautiful pool. Beautiful!

column3: Casablanca Hotel is the best hotel in Casa!
column4: I enjoyed my stay here, the staff and service were excellent. Ambience in the hotel in the evening was perfectly relaxing, piano music and nice atmosphere. The beds are SO comfortable! The staff was very friendly and attentive. I loved my stay here!

This is supposed to be five star. Very disappointing. Gym is awful. Had to go outside. Sometimes resto staff very unresponsive. I had to ask many times for a drink before it was served. I would not stay there on my next trip to Casablanca.

I've just spent 3 nights in this opulent hotel. From the moment we walked through the door our experience has been amazing. From the rooms, to the amazing food in Terrace Jasmine not forgetting the ever helpful & courteous staff it has been an exceptional stay. A special mention to ' The Best Bar Man in Casablanca' Adnane who looked went that little bit further to make sure our stay was special. I highly recommend this hotel.

Excellent hotel in Casablanca, Classy and friendly. Nice piano playing in the lobby. A little expensive but quite elegant. Restaurant & Bar has good food & drink. Nice pool. The staff was helpful and the suites we had (both Orient Express & Art Deco) were awesome. Nice area, safe to walk around, good amount of restaurants.

I had another stay at Le Casablanca. I would personally like to thank Mr. Sefrioui who has all the professionalism and discretion of a good manger, Ahmed and Saied for being so accommodating and Mohamed who is always so incredibly helpful and diligent. Around the hotel, Zineb and Tarik at breakfast, alongside Abdelfattah by the pool are always very professional and welcoming. My only room for improvement would be service on the gorgeous terrace which can sometimes take a little too long. With prices having increased, service would improve in correlation. This remains however, the best hotel in Casablanca (especially if the Cigar stocks are replenished!)

Polite Staff.. Excellent Service .. Delicious Food.. Professionals Housekeeping.. Cooperative Front office .. Beautiful View.. The suite was comfortable.. Everything was great.. Thank you .. Mohamed Atta Director of Operations -- Raffles Makkah Place

column3: Not a 5 star room or experience
column4: Room very dated and scratched up. Hair dryer didn't work. Rude service at Front Desk. Chased us out to taxi at 4 am to sign cc left on file Never treated like this before. Pool very nice but rest needs help

column3: Disgusting hotel with rude customer care
column4: Disgusting hotel with rude customer care. I was struggling with almost everything at the hotel from warm room (AC wasnt working) to supply of water bottles for drinking/coffee inside the room. Everything was overpriced in comparison to the service received.

column3: Elegance and Comfort - A wonderful combination.
column4: It's exquisite and yet extremely comfortable to stay at. They perfected the combination without too much effort. I like everything about it and the beds is very comfortable. I also like it was a quiet hotel so not too much noise. Well done!

This was the most gorgeous, luxurious hotel I have ever even seen! It is worth every single penny- a must do or at least see if you‚Äôre around!! Restaurants and shopping g inside were top notch. I stayed in the Katoub view room, GORGEOUS view of the Mosque!

Gorgeous decor, helpful staff. Rooms are big, well air-conditioned; free breakfast is delicious; outdoor space is nicely decorated. we were only here for a night and I noticed that during the day the main lobby doesn‚Äôt seem to have the lights turned on, though it‚Äôs bright enough with all the windows.

The location of the hotel is super ideal and the hotel gives you a 1001 nights feeling, it is so beautiful and breathtaking. Unfortunately, when we arrived at the hotel, we were not welcomed so friendly by the receptionist M., who works in the evenings. He even refused to answer phones if we needed anything. We passed on our complaint to the front desk manager M'hamed and since then we have had a fantastic stay and we have been lavishly looked after. Our room was spacious and beautifully decorated. The breakfast was very nice and you could eat it while enjoying a very nice terrace and beautiful view. The breakfast staff was very professional and friendly. We definitely recommend the hotel if you are in Casablanca. We would like to thank M'hamed for the good care and‚Ä¶

I found a number of the staff to be less than helpful. The hallways are very badly lit, and some of the public area lights only go on with motion sensors. This is definitely not what one would expect of a five star property. Furthermore, the internet is the worst hotel internet I have ever experienced.

We spent four nights at the hotel in a suite room. The service was excellent and all staff were friendly and welcoming. Excellent breakfast buffet with numerous options and a very proactive waiter who remembered our drinks orders after the first morning. The hotel arranged airport transfers and a driver during our stay for day trips to Marrakech, Fes and sightseeing in Casablanca. The driver was excellent and the car very comfortable. We visited the spa and were very happy with the massages we received. Overall I would highly recommend this as a great place to stay in Casablanca.

From the moment we walked through the door to the time we left, the staff were incredibly happy and helpful. This was easily our best experience in years and the hotel owners should be very proud of their staff! The location is beautiful and the hotel was clean and well-maintained.

The staff was professional and courteous upon arrival until my departure. They paid attention to every detail and more importantly delivered what they promised. Once we arrived about 30 minutes before the restaurant open but the still allowed us to dine and I thank them for that.

Relaxing and friendly staff , very good location and highly recommend to be your choice in the next trip to Casablanca, reception staff were more the friendly and helpful , efficient and professional and fast , the problem was the MIs connection WIFI

the hostel is under renovation , and no informed us upon checking , we booked a premium room at 3000dh , everything was fine until the noise of the construction started early morning . i think its not fair to do not inform the clients before their satay

column3: A trip back to the Gilded Age of Hollywood
column4: This hotel is absolutely beautiful and I immediately thought of famous people from around the world strutting around in their tuxes and evening gowns. The lobby is gorgeous while being inviting. The rooms were roomy and luxurious and the breakfast buffet the following morning was sumptuous! We were able to dine outside on a lovely morning. there is a wall of black and white photos of well known celebrities who have stayed here in the past. We only had one night given our itinerary but it was worth it.

This hotel is perfect. The halls have a gorgeous amber scent and the rooms and public areas are lovely. Despite not being centrally located, it was easy to get a taxi, front desk was friendly and efficient. Pool area quiet and relaxing, great breakfast buffet.

This was the first hotel I stayed at in Morocco. The following hotels in other cities could not live up to this one. It was beautiful and clean, everyone was helpful and friendly, and the food was fantastic. I would visit the restaurant even if I weren't staying there.

Having a wonderful afternoon at Le Casablanca Hotel. Eating lunch at the terrace. The service provided by all the staff is excellent. Zakaria our waiter, went above and beyond to make us feel welcome, and we already feel like we have been friends for a long time . Food is excellent, and the place is perfect. Service is everything !

I was very surprised by this hotel very classy, amazing architecture Very welcoming staff at check-in Food & service are excellent very friendly and efficient staff Beautiful terasse overlooking the pool & garden Rooms very confy with clarins amenities & welcome basket Thank you for everything See you soon

Rooms were clean and well furnished for comfort and luxury. Staff was polite, professional and helpful. Food quality was good and restaurant staff was punctual and friendly. Overall would definitely recommend this place to future travelers.

Everything is nice. The hotel is beautiful and comfortable. Rooms are spacious. Wifi can be very slow during the evening/night. I stayed during Ramadan and breakfast was not buffet, and there was not many choices, but it's understandable. Food in the restaurant was very nice. Hope to return.

I arrived at night on 15April2022. The male receptionist was helpful and polite. He even escorted me to find a table for the dinner that night. He was the great example of a front liner in hospitality business to represent the hotel‚Äôs image. Unlike the female receptionist on the following day, I had to come twice to check on her about the late check-out and she didn‚Äôt even bother. She was busy on the phone and looked not approachable. The food selection for dinner was excellent but the breakfast was not. The room was excellent. Clean environment. Polite staff.

Our stay was too short to be able to really enjoy the hotel, but the room was spacious and the welcome and departure both efficient and courteous. Would definitely choose to stay here again for a longer stay and enjoy the pool and spa facilities and breakfast.

Very nice hotel for an overnight in Casablanca, breakfast room is airy and light with possible patio area depending upon the weather! big breakfast selection We were kindly upgraded to a lovely room! Baggage porter service early morning is poor be careful if you have an early flight

The room was well appointed, with a hair dryer, Nespresso coffee machine, safe, robes, slippers and a comfortable queen bed with a comforter. It was a pretty standard size for a hotel room, but comfortable. The breakfast had everything you could want including omelet station, cereal, toast, fruits, cold cuts, french pastries, smoked salmon, cold cuts and ‚Ä¶ bacon, a rarity outside Casablanca. They also had Muslim specialties. The gardens are lovely for breakfast in warm weather. A nice pool was tucked in the back. We had a very tasty light lunch in their dining room. The personal are friendly and helpful No‚Ä¶

Great property with nice decoration and architecture, high ceilings, very comfy rooms with high quality amenities, food is great, the service is awesome the team very kind and attentive excellent location close to all main activities in Casablanca in a quiet & residential neighborhood will definitely come back

I am happy to the gotel as they offer Great facility and qualified food and wellcome package. Aslo all staffs are very kind and gentle and good bed for my sleeping. And location ia quite resident area

column3: Good hotel prestigious and beautiful charming
column4: Good hotel well situated charming and classy .. the personal at reception efficient The service at restaurant could do better. Restaurant and bar close early . Nice old style built recently . Stylish but would need more affable personal fir business people

column3: You won‚Äôt receive the value of what you paid

We booked their best suite, yet they asked us to pay an extra Breakfast for our daughter when our daily bill exceeded ‚Ç¨ 400

Very nice hotel would definitely come back here. Service is perfect, rooms are amazing. Food is also very good, hotel is central closed to everything, safe and service is just amazing. would definitely recommendmmend it for holidays or business

column3: Room on the road more than noisy
column4: Staff very friendly and helpfil and hotel very well decorated. That's a pitty when you can for business and mostly to sleep to experience such bad nights. At this level of standard, no room should be so noisy. Me and my colleagues had the impression to sleep outside with all the night traffic.

The hotel was well situated. The staff were incredibly friendly! Make sure they cool your room because we asked the bellman and then tried to do it ourselves, but the room remained a bit hot to sleep. The king bed and mattress were super! The bath was lovely. The breakfast was the best we had in all of the hotels we stayed in across Morocco.

column3: A wonderful hotel with amazing service
column4: I was very pleased with my stay at Le Casablanca. Everyone was extremely helpful and the room and property were very pleasant. I particularly liked the dining and lounge areas. Both the food and entertainment were on par.

Definitly my best stay in Hotel for a long time, High quality product, great restaurant & a beautiful terasse overlooking the garden, service is awesome with very kind & professional staff, Excellent amenities in the room Great experience from check-in to check-out Thank you

We went for a fun trip to Casablanca, The room was big, the bedding was superb and the bathroom nice. But everything else was a mess, the service all together left a lot to desire from the concierge,front desk to the room service(food was edible though). And to be honest quietness of the room was not their strength either. Overall, the experience was not good,especially with a 5 stars hotels and those prices.

Excellent , probably one the best hotel I have been from the last 3 years. Excellent Room, food quality and extraordinary staff. Fast and excellent room service. Didn¬¥t have time to use the SPA but have seen the facilities that are outstanding.

column3: Nice H√¥tel , with an excellent service
column4: I really recommand this H√¥tel during your passage in Casablanca. Very nice breakfast. The environment is quite. The atmosphere in the evening is very nice , with a very relaxing music. I will comeback again.

This is by far the best hotel I have been to in Morocco. The room we had was very nice and cozy. The bed was by far the best I have slept on. Very good view from my room. Staff was awesome too Will definitely book it again

After 2 weeks touring the gorgeous country of Morocco, we were ready for an urban, modern experience. We stayed at this wonderful hotel for 3 nights while the airport was shut down, and every night we went downstairs for dinner and drinks. The restaurant's pasta was excellent and the bar is lively and sophisticated. Zakaria, our server, had the bartender create a special cocktail to my specifications. The sushi served at the bar was also excellent. Highly recommended.

I am very disappointed, the staff at the breakfast were touching food with their dirty hands not using gloves and when I complain they didn‚Äôt perform any service recovery , Moroccan tea tasted like water was very bad the coffee not nice, the buffet was poor !! The room without even one bottle of water. However the staff at the terrace restaurant and the room service were very polite and friendly.

My friend and ai went for dinner at the Brasserie du boulevard and had a great evening. The service was outstanding, thanks to Soufiane and Taoufik who were very attentive and cheerful. The ambiance was fun and entertaining, and the food was good. I highly recommend

This is my 3rd stay at hotel and honestly I couldn‚Äôt never get enough of level of care and attention to details from the hotel employees. By far the best boutique hotel in Casablanca. Keep us the amazing work.

column3: Not bad, but not as god as hyped either
column4: Le Casablanca is a nice hotel but not quite as fantastic as other reviews suggested. Maybe I just set my expectations too high. In short: * the location is pleasant, in a posh residential part of town, within walking / running distance to the waterfront which is nice if you like jogging * the decor of lobby is great, also a very nice terrace with a restaurant * very good breakfast * absolutely great staff, smiling, welcoming, keeping promises - if you agree that the technician to fix the safe should be at 9.15 sharp, he is there at 9.15 sharp but also * a most terrible bed! so soft, that it is difficult to find a position to sleep (one of other guest participating in the same event said he had to move the mattress to the floor) * a very terrible glass door to the bathroom,‚Ä¶

Stylish hotel with fantastic service. Stayed in the Moroccan suite which had the most scrumptious bed (we called it the marshmallow bed it was so comfy and big) . Attention to detail was fantastic. Food and service in the hotel restaurant were first class‚Ä¶our waiter Nadir was attentive and friendly. Overall an experience to remember and we‚Äôll definitely be returning.

column3: Morocco is one of the most beautiful countries in the world and the place will always be in my heart. I am very happy to be in t
column4: It deserves 5 out of 5, very good One of the most beautiful hotels ever, wonderful place, wonderful workers and the level of hospitality beyond description It is a great pleasure to be among you and I am grateful for all that this place has done for me

Excellent service from Nadir and team in the Terrasse. Beautiful hotel and atmosphere with music and nice drinks. I enjoyed the bursts salad, the casaBlanca beer and chateau roselane. The entrec√¥te beef was also good. I would recommend this hotel for all business activity in Casablanca.

Another perfect stay at the Casablanca. The staff do their utmost to make me feel at home which is really important when I have a busy schedule. My thanks to Mohamed Sefrioui, Boutaina and their new colleague Anas at reception. Sefrioui runs a tight ship and this is clear from his team‚Äôs professionalism. My thanks also to Abderrahmane at Room Service and to Zineb at breakfast who was incredibly attentive.

They have best spa service in Casablanca We tried Hammam & message and was clean, and comfy You can take better price for both services together. Still the price for the message itself is good Special thanks to Sanaa & Kawthar Totally recommended

Excellent clean hotel with great service and a delicious breakfast. Breakfast was by the pool outside and there were lots of choices and they were all good. I especially loved the little omelette looking muffins! Service was also excellent! The neighborhood was nice and quieter than other areas of Casablanca.

Delightful setting, charming property and mostly very helpful and professional staff. Menu was a little limited and bar restrictions entirely illogical. Rooms very pleasant and when COViD curfew restrictions are lifted, would return for sure.

Good hotel facilities and friendly service. Resturant information to be improved: some misunderstanding between information given at reception and the resturant itself about dinner time. Also the Room Service menu was not available all the time, although it was not indicated anywhere.

elevator are dirty there is an air conditioner noise pool is perfect meals are excellent personal kindly and always smile reception people are very caring and helpful people (especial thanks Mr Muhammed)

The bathroom flooded every time we took a shower The restaurant closed at 2100h due to Covid restrictions so ordered room service when it arrived it was cold and had to send it back. Why in a Muslim country does this hotel deem it fitting to have paintings of nude women on the walls ? We are in 2021 not 1980. Women should not be degraded in this way. The hotel is a magnate for prostitutes in the bar area which staff seem happy to accommodate

Casablanca is a city with live quality. Modern public transportation system. It is a place with different religions and very tolerant. Many high class hotels and restaurants. From the airport you reach the centre of Casablanca in only 30 minutes with train and car. A nice place to be.

It is a jewel in the city, a petite Oasis Is with an enchanting garden and terrace bar and restaurant. Very polite and efficient staff. Fabulous fabulous buffet breakfast. Is fantastic DJ most nights and we danced in the restaurant! The bed was like sleeping on a cloud. Is very enchanting the garden at night with a lighting and a spotless swimming pool

column3: Beautiful Art Deco property with good service in nice location!
column4: The stunning hotel is located in the ‚Äúbeaux quartiers‚Äù of Casablanca. All in Art Deco, wonderful public areas, bar and restaurant. Lush gardens and pool. Very attentive security, voiturier and bagagiste. Receptionist was excellent, smooth checkin seated with a tasty welcome drink. He managed to book us a table in one of the town‚Äôs best restaurants.

I heard a lot about the Casablanca Hotel after they remodeled it and was curious to check it out. With couple of friends, we made a reservation at 7 :00 PM at THE TERRASSE JASMIN. From the entrance to the hotel until our table we were nicely greeted. Seating area is very nice with an open bar and a beautiful view to the pool √† level down. Service was excellent Food was delicious: we had the best Mozzarella Buratta with heirloom tomatoes dressed with a light pesto sauce , and also an outstanding home smoked salmon . Fresh and crisp Ceasar salad with jumbo shrimps. For entrees we enjoyed the prawns risotto as well as the ribeye steak perfectly prepared. The staff was very friendly, and helpful . One thing got my attention and blew my mind is the attention to detail and‚Ä¶

I would like to thank the hotel and the front desk staff for their hospitality. After arriving with Royal Air Maroc having failed to deliver my luggage, the hotel were very accommodating in making sure that I was looked after as I had no belongings. I would like to personally thank Mohamed Sefroui for extending my checkout very graciously despite the hotel being full. Boutaina was incredibly kind and charming as usually. Wahid and Mounir at the door were obliging and helpful as usual. I genuinely feel at home in the hotel wonderfully looked after by Malika and the housekeeping team.

column3: An amazing/stunning hotel in the heart of Casablanca!
column4: Le Casablanca Hotel is such a beautiful hotel! The entire property was stunning, as well as the rooms. The entire staff, front desk, dining, housekeeping, etc. were very accommodating to our needs. The only item I would like them to improve upon is Wifi signal. Wifi is huge for me. It was not enough to soar my visit. It is one thing that would almost make it a 10 of 10.

column3: A little glamour is exactly what you want in Casablanca
column4: I stayed in this hotel two nights on the end of a three week adventure through Morocco. The Art Deco interior is dreamy and just how you always imagined Casablanca. We dined in a couple of times with no complaints. I loved the sushi. The Manhattans were a little lite on the booze, but definitely enjoyable. Saving the best for last, I have to underscore how wonderful the spa is at this hotel. My friend and I had massages and rank them easily in our global top ten. I can‚Äôt recommend my masseuse, Rona, enough. I would absolutely stay here again.

column3: Executive Vice President / Chief Financial Officer
column4: Staff and Facilities are excellent.....Will certainly recommend Le Casablanca Hotel to all of my business contacts, family and friends is they are planning on visiting Casablanca. Please share this review with your staff and let them know that their service was extraordinary and greatly appreciated.....my thanks and best wishes to all......Peter Dominici

My wife and I went out for dinner every night and after staying for 5 nights we walked into the hotel one evening around 11pm. We were waiting for the elevator and the lady receptionist came running to me and asked what room number I had and if my room was for 2 people. She thought my wife was a lady I took with me for 1 night. A 5 star hotel should know and treat all its guests well instead of asking such an insulting question.

Our third week at the hotel and what a pleasant experience. Good room and amenities notwithstanding COVID limitations. Unique differentiator is the friendly and obliging staff and nothing is a problem. Zineb and Sufian at breakfast and Boutaina at reception deserve a special mention. Would highly recommend this hotel whether travelling on business or holiday

This is by far the best hotel in Casablanca. The service was perfect. The staff was very kind and always available to accommodate any request. Everything about the stay was unbelievably perfect. I have to put a special emphasis on the quality and comfort of the mattresses, pillows and comforters. It was just excellent.

column3: Solid Hotel to Start Moroccan Vacation
column4: Stayed at Le Casablanca for one night in route to Marrakech. It was the perfect hotel to rest before the start of a vacation around the country. They let us check in well before the check in time. The pool was great to lounge around. The room had a large bath to soak away all the aches from a long flight. During the evening Terrasse Jasmin was great for dinner and drinks. Beautiful ambiance and dj. Request Sofian for superb service to cap off your evening with fine dining. He makes great food recommendations.

column3: Room service was awful specially as I depend on it big time during covid and during curfew time. Also wifi was bad
column4: Room service was awful specially as I depend on it big time during covid and during curfew time. Also wifi was bad Always which was actually one of the reasons to choose the hotel. Water is very limited one or two small bottles. Nespresso capsules were only 4 that was in the room on my first day was not renewed during all my stay (10 days)!!! I won‚Äôt recommend the hotel in the future. Definitely very expensive compared to the service and not worth for money.

This was my first trip to Casa and the hotel recommended to me was excellent both in terms of comfort and staff help and service. I thoroughly enjoyed my 4 days at the hotel and would certainly recommend it to friends and colleagues

Top experience , i really appreciate the localisation , the h√¥tel is really beautifull and all the staff is really nice and professionnal , will come back soon , the quality of the bed was also at 10/10 .

column3: I stay there from 12/24 up to 12/27 and the 01/01/21 up to 01/03/2021
column4: It was very good all my visit this is the 4th time I stay at the La Casablanca hotel this is one of my best places I stay I love the service and the food I will Differently recommend it to anybody thank you to all of you in the La Casablanca Hotel üç∑üç∑üç∑üòÉ

Fantastic staff with great attention to details, super clean and comfortable room, and great location!! Very classy inside. Breakfast was also very good. Check in and check out was super fast too. Will definitely come back!

column3: My Brilliant Stay in Le Casablanca Hotel
column4: I stayed in this fabulous hotel three times over this month. The hotel was nothing short from spectacular and it will always be my hotel of choice when I‚Äôm in Casablanca next. When I first arrived, I was greeted by Said at the front office. Said was not only professional but warm and welcoming. He genuinely cared and ensured that my stay is comfortable. He offered me Moroccan tea and sweets which were delicious and were what I needed after a long journey. I had a minor issue with my payment method and he resolved it promptly, assuring me that it was not a problem. I also dealt with M‚Äôhamed who was equally professional and friendly. Like Said, M‚Äôhamed was also very personable and polite. There was something different about both Said and M‚Äôhamed which made them stand out and made‚Ä¶

column3: Sweet Memorable Stay at Le Casablanca hotel in Morocco
column4: The warm welcome and pick up at the airport by our driver Hammouda, started our trip off on the right foot. Hammouda was very polite, kind, helpful and excellent driver. When we arrived at the hotel for check-in, we had welcome drinks of traditional Moroccan tea and snacks, this was really amazing. The gentlemen who worked at the bellhop, was very helpful assisting with my luggage etc. Said checked us in at the front desk, he was also extremely polite, relatable and resourceful helping myself and others with me, guiding us in the right direction on where to visit, what to eat etc. The art decor theme throughout the hotel and in my room was just amazing to look at. M'hamed at the front desk next day, was also very helpful and kind, assisting myself for another day of my‚Ä¶

column3: Shame for this nice art deco hotel the service is missing
column4: We organized a seminar with clients and officials, organized a lunch in the restaurant already the service at the lunch was not up to the standard given our spent, the dessert took 45 minutes to reach while we were supposed to be a VIP table. We booked the dinner there again and it turned into a night mare when we were supposed to have a relaxed time. It is a pity because the hotel is well located and nicely decorated. The service ruined the stay and the memories, this is constructive feedback for improvements, when you pay 5 stars pricing you expect 5 stars services which is not yet the case

column3: Great establishment, with every offer needed for a super customer experience
column4: The friendly staff from reception desk (Bouthaina's is a professional host) to the restaurant made the stay very special in difficult pandemic measures and conditions. I felt very safe and well served despite the closure of certain facilities.

A wonderfully decorated and clean hotel in the heart of the city. Conveniently located near dining and other activities. Friendly and attentive staff are helpful without being intrusive. The pool area is excellent for sitting and having a drink away from the busyness of the city.

Excellent H√¥tel. Excellent Staff. Excellent restaurant . Excellent overall. Beautiful hotel. Beautiful rooms. Thank you for your kindness . I will definitely return to this hotel. Thank you . Thank you Simon knafo

Hotel well located in residential area, friendly and professional welcoming, room very comfy especially the beds, breakfast menu with fresh produces and excellent service, staff are very friendly and helpful, will definitely recommend and will definitely come back on my next stays

Recomended to my business colleagues, warm wellcome, good location, good cuisine and service. Rooms clean, spacious, confortable bed and pillows. Good hygene, need to improve bath experience. Good transportation service.

Beautifully styled and fantastic staff, nothing was ever too much to ask, they aimed to please and made our stay an exceptional one. The Rooms are spacious and comfortable, the food in the various restaurants was outstanding and everywhere you go within the hotel the people are friendly and go out of their way to be helpful.

Nice place, very warm service and rooms are well equipped Central location. Ideal for business meetings. The great spa team can help you relax The breakfast is fine but has margin for improvement Will comeback

Great room, great food, not too far from the centre. Bed's were extremely comfortable. Breakfast really good, if slightly expensive, with good variety of hot, cold, cereals, including oats, granola, chia seeds, pumpkin sedds, dried fruit, smoked salmon, etc, etc. Highly recommended all round.

column3: Beautiful Hotel in the heart of the city
column4: Our last night in Morocco was wonderful at the hotel. Room was updated, spacious and comfortable bed. This was with our tour group so our last dinner was lovely and delicious. From our room we had a view of both the largest mosque and another one next to the ocean. It is set in an upscale neighborhood with lovely landscape all around. The staff was responsive when we called for extra towels. Would stay again.

so clean and comfortable. I suggest putting in hand rails in bathtub and no-slip surface for safety. The multiple glass doors in bathroom made movement somewhat difficult or dangerous when floors are wet. Enjoyed the indoor pool.

It's the second time that i stay in Le Casablanca and i felt again the same experience. The staff is very welcoming and helpful. The hotel well situated for both business and leisure. It's clean and luxurious but you have a sentiment of peace when you're inside. I strongly recommend it.

Everything was amazing untill the check out where I was wrongfully accused of stealing/taking towels from the room and had to open my bags to prove I had nothing in my Bags. It was done in a polite way but I genuinely believe it shouldn‚Äôt have been done at the first place. It‚Äôs embarrassing and shameful

Comfortable first class hotel with first class service and staff. Prices to match. close to a couple of good restaurants and has it's own first class restaurant and bar. Our room was clean, comfortable, quiet and reasonable size

We spent one night at the hotel. It was our last night in Morocco so it was really nice to have a place to relax. The staff was most helpful, a very nice bar, and wonderful food. The room was spacious and bright.I am sorry we didn't have more time to enjoy everything the hotel had to offer.

column3: worst welcome i ever had apperently kids are forbidden to enter the lobby
column4: They stopped my children at the main entrance. This was just entering the lobby to reach the restaurant. Most rude doorman i ever met, and 2 receptionists ( one lady who did talk to me..) and her male collegue who gave me the death stare. What happenend ? i had been here twice before, ate at the terrace with my kids ( 10 and 17 and 19 ) with the pictures in my phone to prove it. However this time it was soooo embarrasing as i had 2 kids outside the revolving door , the youngest one in the lobby, and everyone panicking about a lovely pretty well dressed little girl in the lobby ??? We were eventually escorted to another restaurant on the street side.... We ate quickly and left. NEVER again, such a shame as normally all Moroccan people are super kind sweet and nice to kids.

This conveniently located hotel has large lovely rooms and a good staff. The pool area is nicely landscaped and the balcony is lovely for a cocktail before dinner. The included breakfast was excellent.

Great room accommodations. The bed was comfortable, the entire hotel was clean and the food was delicious. We used the Spa to get a Hammam and loved it. All the staff was friendly and helpful. Thank you for your hospitality.

It's a wonderful hotel. I just wish the windows were a bit tighter. We could hear the many motorcycles rushing by at night. It has a great decor, good food, a great DJ, and good location- all were memorable.

Very helpful and kind staff. Large, clean and comfortable rooms. Expansive buffet for breakfast but expensive. Bar and dining room also expensive but is a very luxurious hotel so that's why the food is expensive.

Beautiful accommodation. A+ for service and comfort. The staff were welcoming and could not have been more polite and helpful. Our room was spacious and the beds were very comfortable. Our 3:30 am request for a room delivered breakfast was timely and delicious.

The Staff was very helpful at the Desk in helping me find things to do in your City The service I got at the Restaurant and at Breakfast was great overall the stay was very pleasant and I would recumbent your Hotel anytime

The facility is very clean and quite comfortable. I really enjoyed the oh-so comfy bed after a lot of traveling. My friend and I had dinner in the hotel Saturday evening and enjoyed the food and atmosphere of the restaurant. The servers were quite good at their craft. The one thing that I do not like in this hotel, and others we stayed in, is the way the lights work. Having to use the key card to turn on all lights is not always convenient and when removing to leave for any reason all lights go off. I do not like to return to a dark room while away or home. Other than that one thing, I enjoyed by stay there.

A lovely hotel that I look forward to returning to someday. The entire hotel experience is all wrapped up in this one place. The bed and pillows are so comfortable, the staff throughout the hotel is magnificent.

I spent one night at Le Casablanca Hotel January 10th, 2020. The room was exceptionally comfortable, clean and elegant. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and the restaurant was excellent. I would definitely stay again.

Just an overnight with a group tour. Very nice hotel with fantastically comfortable bed. However the room service breakfast before early morning departure was disappointing. Cold runny eggs and hard cold bread basket were inedible. Coffee and juice were fine.

column3: Was a great stay in a lovely hotel.
column4: Really luxurious and comfortable. Maybe the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. I stayed on business for two weeks, and every morning, Soufiane, Mustapha and Zineb really looked after us, with the most delicious breakfast in Casablanca. Thank you for the wonderful stay.

The staff was very accommodating and friendly. Very nice and clean rooms. Showers had good water pressure and were large. The hotel is nicely located. Elevators were roomy and quick. Everything was top notch except for the restaurant service.

Waited 2 hours for chicken, you wanted to send up to my room, when I canceled you decided to charge me. Terrible experience terrible, terrible, teirroble, terrible. Terrible , terrible terrible, terrible, trrrible, terrible, terrible,"..........................

Stayed for some days in this simple and nice place. I had a spacious room with a nice view on high floor. Delicious basic breakfast buffet. Restaurant staff were very friendly. Close to cafe and restaurants. Would stay there again

actually was there six month ago the food and service was very excellent and i enjoy it , But yesterday i was shocked üò≥i order the chicken as usually did it‚Äôs was discusting i was very mad about it , Thank god the service still in good shape Big thanks to the staff but the kitchen u should do somthing about it guys , thank u !

We checked in late after 1 am and everything was fine. Looked to do laundry and process were rediculous $5 for a pair of socks. I got 6 kilo of laundry for $20 in the neighborhood. Location was great for or needs. Walk to Jaffa an to Carmel Market. Breakfast buffet was acceptable, not great. You call those things bagels?

Overall nice experience, better than other same standing hotels in town. Perfectly situated between Maarif and Anfa. Casa port is becoming hell for car drivers because of the endless construction projects there.

Difficult to describe the quality of this hotel Amazing room, huge, big bed and very comfortable Toilet big as well. Very clean. Nice bar with daily DJ (low volume) Beautiful garden and pool For me, the location was perfect My rate is not 5 because I didn‚Äôt have the opportunity to go to breakfast (probably very good) Own transportation service available, always a valeu. Staff polite Fully recommend

Only one night in Casablanca on New Years Eve and perfect place to stay. Liked it so much we will return tomorrow night- one day early to catch more of Casablanca before our flight back to JFK! Great service, room, breakfast and garden.

I stayed here for two nights, and will definitely go back. It was the best bed ever, the indoor pool was amazing with its massage corners, and the meals were excellant. The balcony dining overlooking the garden is delightful, and the indoor dining room ia quite romantic.

Everything about this Hotel was 5 stars The location, the staff, the food. We were a tour group of 17 and they accommodated us as if we were VIPs. The service was excellent, the rooms beautifully decorated and pristine.

I am very happy to write this review even this is a bit late It's my first visit to Morocco, after Marrakech, fes, rabat My last night was at the Casablanca hotel A sublime palace worthy of 5 stars and more I am from California whose sale and production of foie gras is prohibited, I had several choices on the menu, but with the help of ms sofian who explained the content very well, once he told me proposed the foie gras terrine I was super happy and even the tears in the eyes because really it's been years that I haven't tasted that With a good glass of wine casablanca it was an unforgettable evening for me Thank you very much for the welcome, the kindness and the advice Very good sofian job and good luck

Power went out in our room at 12:15am when switching on the bathroom light. All circuits tied together in the room so nothing worked, including the telephone We had to pack and shower by iPhone light. Whole hotel, including rooms, Smelled of awful perfume. It was a terrible experience.

column3: Excellent choice for luxury leisure or business travel in Casablanca!
column4: I stayed at the Hotel Casablanca for 3 nights in December and was extremely impressed by the quality of my stay from the minute I checked in to the minute I checked out. In addition to the beautiful design, architectural look of the property and very tasteful Christmas decorations, I was most impressed by the service and the international standards of luxury used to attend to guests throughout the hotel including in the reception area, the restaurant, the bar and guest services. It is hard to believe that this hotel is owned by an individual and not by a global chain. The owner has clearly put a lot of resources, thoughts and efforts training the staff and it shows. The experience had nothing to envy to any stay I had in many luxury hotels in Europe, Asia or the‚Ä¶

The hotel property was lovely, but I was only there for 1 night. The woman at the front desk was unwelcoming. The standout for me was the restaurant. Truly first class food and service. Waiter Mohammed provided thoroughly professional service, and does so with a great sense of humor and wit. I look forward to returning to La Brasserie.

Good deal : regarding the price and the quality of the equipement of the room. The staff is profesionnal. The breakfast is generous and delicious. The room is well beside the view. I did appreciate the h√¥tel.

We organize an International Conference at the hotel and everything went just perfect: room for more than 100 people, equipment, lunch and coffee breaks, etc. Thanks to Mme. MGOUNI to coordinate our event.

Very good, efficient and comfortable hotel. Rooms are spacious, clean, quiet and well organized. I liked the shade between the bathroom and the bedroom. There is an espresso machine. I will recommend it.

Although our stay was short (only two nights), we were most impressed with this hotel. We especially enjoyed the restaurant. The staff bent over backwards to accommodate us - we wanted to eat early (6:00) so they served us even though they normally open at 7:00. Also, one of our group was having a birthday, so they brought a cake and sang to her! The food was outstanding, and the chef even came out to talk to us at our table. What a wonderful experience!

This hotel is located at a central location, offering easy access to city central. The lobby and overall facilities are very nicely decorated. The rooms are spacious and clean, some rooms have access to a patio. Breakfast was very good. Staff was OK but not able to address simple requests like finding a place for dinner as the hotel restaurant closes early.

This is a beautiful modern hotel. It has all the amenities one would want including a lovely restaurant and bar. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The staff is welcoming as well as efficient and helpful. Room service is excellent, timely and delicious.

I was pleasantly surprised by both Casablanca and Le Casablanca hotel. The hotel really was beautiful, great service, clean rooms and traditional Moroccan feeling. One of the best hotels in Cas I'm sure. Highly recommended.

column3: Friendly staff, delicious food, clean rooms!
column4: Dining was fantastic here! Best scallops ever, amazing deserts. Servers were friendly, spoke English, and very responsive. Our server Sofian took great care of us. The chef stopped by and seemed genuinely interested in our experience. The spa was great. I had the signature hammam experience and the masseuse (Sana) was amazing! Rooms were very clean and bed was super soft.

The hotel is lovely. It deserves it 5 start rating. The lighting in the rooms could be better, but all in all it was a delightful stay. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The facilities were lovely and well maintained.

column3: Fine dining restaurant at Le Casablanca hotel
column4: The restaurant provided a welcome change from the typical food served in Morocco as it was distinctively French. We ate there both in the beginning and the end of our 21 day trip to Morocco and were impressed both times.

column3: If you are tired of Morocco, this is a great stay
column4: I stayed at Le Casablanca as the last night of my tour of the country. It is a beautiful hotel. Elegant Art Deco decor, very comfortable and well appointed room. We were graciously received with mint tea and pastry upon arrival. There is DJ music in the lobby in the evening. It has a beautiful restaurant and bar. Service was excellent. This is a great place to stay if you don‚Äôt want to feel like you are in Morocco. There is very little to tell you where you are once you are in the hotel. I prefer the exquisite riads that are all over Morocco. That said. I had a very comfortable stay before the 1 hour drive to the airport.

The hotel while new gave a sense of elegance and comfort associated with a much earlier time.Staff were gracious and very helpful and as this came at the end of a very busy two week tour was very appreciated. Lovely

We were welcomed with traditional mint tea upon arrival while our luggage was ushered to our room. The room was spacious, well appointed and had sliding glass doors to a French balcony over the marquis which looked out across the city. Thermostats are individually controlled. Included breakfast was more than just a petit dejeuner but a complete breakfast buffet served up with access to a beautiful garden area to dine al fresco. The bar area is very interesting in that they have a full stock of liquor and can present a fantastic straight-up martini. There is a beautiful set of books containing art, music, history & culture and photographs housed in this space which are accessible for viewing while enjoying your libation. The restaurants on the premises are first rate and‚Ä¶

column3: Not so clean, clogged shower and poor gym facilities
column4: It was an overall pleasant stay but there were some things that ruined the whole experience. When I arrived I got the room at around 15:00 as it was not ready any earlier, and when I entered the room the bathroom smelled as if the previous visitor had just got out of there, due to very poor ventilation. Also in the bathroom there was no way to keep water from dripping out when having a shower due to a badly installed glass and faulty rubbery part beneath that (room 309), which by the way was clogged and the water would not go down the drain properly. On the plus side the bed was very very comfortable and the choice of mattress and pillows is excellent.

My room was very cold. I contacted the front desk and had a person come. He could not fix it. Then 2 men came. I went out to dinner and the same happened again. I went to the front desk and asked to have someone who spoke English. Not being able to fix it at 10:45 pm they offered me another room. This room which I stayed in was inferior to my first room. They could have handled my situation better.

Our OAT tour group of 8 stayed at this lovely, 5-star hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed talking with an outgoing porter because he likes Georgia! The live music was great and requested he sing "Georgia on My Mind". The shrimp spring rolls were yummy along with a small salad on the plate. We took advantage of a free glass of wine coupon with this delicious appetizer. The only thing I didn't care for was a strong, forced fragrance in the hallways.

column3: Our one night stay at Le C H
column4: An elegant Art Deco hotel. Beautifully furnished, aromatherapy, excellent staff. Meals were yummy. Excellent service. We ate a quiet dinner upon arrival. Fun to have the chef come out & greet us. Breakfast buffet next am was delicious.

column3: Great hotel for a Casablanca visit
column4: We arrived and instantly felt welcomed with hot tea and cookies provided while our group checked in. The room was spacious and very clean. The terrace and grounds were very inviting. We used room service for a very early AM breakfast since we had an early flight and it arrived on time and was delicious complete with warm pastries. The front desk staff were extremely helpful.

A beautiful place to stay on my last night in Morocco. Clean ,comfortable and convenient. Great breakfast and dreamy bed. I would recommend to my friends . This was a lovely big city experience after being in more rural and ancient areas.

This hotel is beautiful with great Art Deco decoration. It is well maintained and confortable . It has recently added the Michelin Star chef Sylvain Brucato is a great chef. We ate twice in the restaurant once for lunch and another time in the evening and as a frequent visitor to Casablanca I would consider it today as one of the best tables available. The foie gras was excellent and the fillet steak melted in my mouth cooked to perfection. This chef is clearly talented and I would strongly advise not to miss eating in this restaurant of the hotel. In addition there was an agreeable non imposing singer giving a great atmosphere. Looking at the people in the restaurant it is clearly a restaurent in vogue.

The food was cooked perfectly. Executive Chef ensured his staff prepared the foods that my digestive tract was able to digest. He took the time to recommend specific dishes. His pleasant smile and personality allowed me to feel comfortable with no rushing. He was genuinely interested to ensure that the kitchen prepared the foods that would keep me healthy and comfortable. The personal attention made me feel well cared for and that is so important travelling in a foreign country. Thank you to Sylvain Brucato. You made a huge , positive impact to my day during my stay at Le Casablanca Hotel.

column3: Beautiful 5 star hotel in lovely neighbourhood
column4: I was tossing up between Le Casablanca Hotel and the Four Seasons. I was happy with my choice in Le Casablanca, and booked a second night. It is a new hotel located in a good neighbourhood. It boasts an impressive entrance, greeting guests with an elaborate crystal chandelier, a striking bar with sexy plush velvet lounges, and an absolutely beautiful terrace perfect day or night. Come daytime, the pool sparkles in its aquamarine glory, with vibrant bougainvillaea‚Äôs hanging around the edges, lined with inviting daybeds. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a Suite (412) which was stunning, spacious and luxurious. We ate dinner on the terrace enjoying delicious sushi, burrata, steak and apple tarte tin. The service was a little disappointing with the potato fondant accompanying‚Ä¶

Rooms are as spacious as they‚Äôre noisy. You can barely find sleep with the ongoing traffic and poorly equipped windows. Staff at front desk is extremely unfriendly. Left a phone charger in my room, called the next day, ¬´ we didn‚Äôt find it Sir ¬ª. Never again.

column3: Great place, great amenities and spa !
column4: The localisation and outside look of the hotel is already appealing. When you first enter the lobby, you are immediately transported back in time with an art deco style bar and a wonderful view on the garden from the terrace. The rooms are good and the people at the spa are very professional. Great experience.

Beautiful property, excellent service. Rooms are very well appointed, buffet breakfast is amazing. I also ate dinner at the restaurant one evening and the food was one of the best meals that I had during my 3 week stay in Morocco.

After a long flight, we ended up in Hotel Le Casablanca. From the very begin, we were treated most friendly and we decided to have lunch on the Terrace. The room was spacious and clean and we particularly liked the breakfast. We can recommend Le Casablanca Hotel without reservation.

We stayed here on our final night of a 2+ week trip in Morocco. The hotel is lovely - the spa was wonderful and the beds were some of the comfiest we found. However, the smoking in the bar area is unfortunate. Outside I understand, but there is literally no reprieve for non-smokers.

Enjoyed our 4 day stay here on our trip from Barcelona before joining a Morocco land tour. Beautiful room as and great pool. Staff was helpful and WiFi was excellent. Easy access to main tourist areas and restaurants.

luxurious room, same to all the hotel, staff members are completly focus to give the best, that is surely one of the best experience i have been , if i am traveling a lot, i was extremly pleased to stay there, for sure i ll be there next time, after a good work and tired travel, that is very nice to spend 2 days in this pleasant hotel,

It‚Äôs all about service. The staff were so friendly and helpful always ready to make your stay perfect. Nice rooms, lobby and two powerful restaurants. One of the concierges went way out of his way after hours to ensure the rugs I bought were legitimate and purchased at a fair price. We went to the location together after I made the purchase. The artisan cooperative facility was accommodating to us and we both felt reassured. So special thanks to Abderrhim and the others. Great location and even better staff.

column3: Beautiful hotel, some issues with payment systems
column4: The hotel is beautiful and the service was excellent. However there was an issue with my pre-payment that the hotel could not locate initially, but they did eventually with some help from my side. I blame this as much on booking.com (where I made the booking), as they were not at all clear on the pre-payment policy. Next time I will book with the hotel directly to avoid such confusion.

The hotel is located in the heart of the fabulous safe and accessible quiet district of Anfa I hesitated between the brasserie and the terrace but since I need sun in my country I opted for the terrace and I'm not sorry immaculate setting quiet and relaxing menu not vary like that of the brasserie but for a terrace snaking it's top Not to mention the reception and the service of Mortada who is really professional available and with an impressive baggage and knowledge I want to encourage him to thank him and wish him good luck Too bad the scent that reigns over the hotel is a house secret Good luck it was my discovery of the summer I would not hesitate to come back

It is very good hotel . The hotel has European style. It is clean However, transportation is not available with normal price. Most their services are considered excellent. Comparing to the room, it is very good.

Excellent and elegant Hotel, very friendly and professional team as well. Very comfortable rooms and bed, great lobby with piano and singer, and a nice bar. Free wifi, very nice and tasty breakfast, small gym (mainly for cardio), beautiful outdoor pool and sitting area. Location is not bad as well. Well worth the stay and a really nice Spa as well

column3: My Beautiful Engagement at Le Casablanca
column4: We stayed in the Le Suite Art Deco: the bathroom, separated by frosted glass doors, was the biggest I've ever seen and the bed was accented with mini crystal chandeliers covering the lights. The best part of this hotel and the whole reason I wanted to book it was the Terrasse Jasmin. A mix of black & white striped curtains against a two story ceiling and views of the impeccably landscaped dining patio, pool and garden area. My fave feature were the 4 ft tall black iron standing chandeliers all over the property! Giving this hotel a shout out bc my fiancee - along with a lot of help from the hotel staff - planned the most romantic engagement here. I wish I would've remembered the server's name as he had a private dinner setup on the patio outside and everything from the‚Ä¶

The hotel is new and very well decorated. Comfortable rooms and perfect size. Nice view to Casablanca city. Suitable for leisure and business travel types. Staff polite and helpful. Wifi good. Breakfast is very good facing pool and nice garden. The hotel is far from city center. Transportation provided by hotel to air port cost around $65 but in luxury car.

We arrived after a 5 hour car journey from Essaouira. We were tired and looking forward to relaxing. The hotel was perfect for us and our room was beautifully appointed wit Clarins bathroom amenities.. We chose it from research and reviews. It did not disappoint, in fact it surpassed expectations. The hotel is stylish and high end luxury. Staff friendly and helpful. Great areas for relaxing with a drink or eating. We headed straight for the pool which was hardy used whilst we were there. The pool attendant very attentive and looked after us well. This is not a resort but has everything you need to chill out and relax including a Spa. Breakfast was simple, for example no cooking station, but provided everything you would want. The hotel is in the financial district so need a‚Ä¶

I checked into the Casablanca Hotel after having been messed around at the Four Seasons. From the moment I entered the hotel Mlle. Bouthaina, supported by her team were only too ready to meet every request and very kindly upgraded my stay to a charming room with a view. Her role was central to my having booked to stat once again, she is both professional and incredibly polite. The hotel is by all means a boutique hotel, so there are moments when one is left calling for services without response. The bell boys are incredibly helpful and accommodating. I'd have hoped that the hotel's owners would have invested some the great returns they have made on encouraging or indeed painting the shoddy building nearby. This is a quick fix, however it is very common in Morocco that‚Ä¶

column3: Luxurious oasis in a chaotic city
column4: I loved staying at this hotel, it exudes luxury upon arrival. Definitely the best hotel bed I have ever slept in by far, like sleeping in a cloud. By far my favourite, a beautiful and tranquil terrace to escape the chaotic streets of Casablanca. Decor is elegant and tasteful. Very pleasant staff, I want to personally acknowledge Soufiane and Mohcine, both of whom were extremely kind and very attentive, excellent examples of fine hotel service thank you! I will be staying here again when I return to Casablanca.

column3: Compliments To the Best Waiter in Town !
column4: Mohamed Cheklaoui was our waiter. We've been in Casablanca Hotel terrasse many time but first time he was our waiter. Extremely polite, knowledgable and very friendly he really made our visit perfect! Before we asked for something he attended to our needs with the best smile! He was the one thing that would make us go back again anytime! Thanks Mohammed

column3: Which is the best hotel in Casablanca - this one or not?
column4: I am lucky enough to travel frequently and extensively all over the world, staying in the very best hotels. I stayed at Le Casablanca Hotel in August 2019, during my fourth tour of Morocco. Prior to my stay, I stayed at La Mamounia in Marrakech and Kasbah Tamadot in the Atlas Mountains. This was my fourth visit to Casablanca and each time I have tried to work out which hotel might be the best. There is a wide choice and no clear winner, I sense. - The hotel is prettily designed, with a lovely garden, small but beautiful pool and an attractive exterior. - The beds are large and very comfortable with a firm mattress and soft bedding. - The rooms are a good size, well equipped, with plenty of plug sockets. - The wifi and air conditioning work well. - The hotel is around 15 minutes‚Ä¶

After 10 nights traveling around Morocco on a tour, we wanted somewhere relaxing and comfortable for our honeymoon, with a pool, great food, and a bar. I had booked a standard room for the evening. In checking in, we had an upgraded suite at no extra charge, which was an extra surprise for our last night in Casablanca. (Or was supposed to, rather. Our flight was canceled the next day, and got stuck in another hotel the next night. Never book Royal Air Maroc.) I would highly recommend Le Casablanca Hotel.

column3: Best place to stay in Casablanca
column4: Beautiful hotel, comfortable and stylish rooms! Would definitely stay here again. I loved the fruit that was in my room. The bed was really comfortable. The atmosphere on the patio was really nice. Service was great too!

I spent one night here and thoroughly enjoyed the entire experience. The staff at the hotel were very attentive, and in every instance provided exceptional service. I had lunch and drinks by the pool and the setting and experience were amazing. I also ate dinner in what they call the snack area, and the sushi was great as was the scene. I would definitely recommend and should I find myself in Casa again I will definitely return.

Beautiful Hotel, boutique concept where people are very friendly and where it feels very at home rather than a standard hotel. Very well located with a Starbucks, Paul Caf√©, Gapi around and 5 min driving from the sea

We simply love this hotel. Great customer service and fantastic place. Rooms are very comfortable and the two restaurants just perfect to enjoy a beautiful dinner at the terrace. The breakfast is great too in the patio. Close to everything

Le Casablanca is a beautifully maintained art deco hotel that exudes the elegance of a bygone age yet is a comfortable and relaxing place to be. The black and white marble flooring is set off with predominently back, red and cream colour tones for fabrics and furnishings. The result is stunning. Well maitained grounds with wonderful relaxing outdoor pool. Bedrooms are stylish and comfortable- decent size. Bathrooms with tub and shower above. Staff very welcoming and efficient and friendly throughout hotel. This hotel is 'Casablanca' !

If you book a room 3 weeks in advance with advance payment option (no changes or cancellation allowed), then after 5 hours flight and custom formalities arrive to hotel and they say you SORRY, because some guests destroyed some rooms and for tonight we will send you to Barcelo Hotel and tomorrow will bring back, HOW WOULD YOU FEEL? When I asked to see a destroyed empty room, of course they could not show me. They sell same room to more than one guest if demand is high. Take care

Very unhelpful staff, namely at restaurants. Confusing information, unfriendly waiters (except breakfast service). Housekeeping on very poor level. Despite this, probably only one possible accommodation in the city during business trip (if you won't need anything).

Sevice was excellent. The restaurant, the spa, the reception, the bar, the petit dejeuner - all were excellent. We will be staying with you there 20-30 days a year. We look forward to returning. Thank you.

column3: Beautiful hotel, kind staff, lovely pool
column4: I wish I had more than one night here ... relaxing, upscale (without being pretentious) and clean. The pool is large, they serve drinks to you IN the pool (which is quite nice). Rooms are spacious and have nice amenities.

column3: Even for just an overnight stay you will be very comfotable
column4: At the end of a long trip, at the end of a long day a quick sign in, a comfortable and well equipped room and friendly staff are always welcome. I even got some hand holding from the staff with the computer system in confirming plane reservations It was not the website or the program that were inscrutable but the keyboard is not the std us keyboard. Restaurant service was prompt and food reasonable prices reasonable and service quick even as sunset approached during Ramadan.
