the hotel is very confortable and the staff is very profesional and kindly.You can taste the breakfast, the lunch and the dinner, they are delicious.It's really a very good hotel . the quality of the food, the staff of the Spa and the swimming pool is high level. By the way you can trust all the staff of the reception they are very profesional.

I become a regular customer during my several business trips to Casablanca. Top room, clean, top service, top breakfast. Don‚Äôt miss the pool party to relax. Gym area is a bit small and unfortunately not open all the time.

I recently stayed in this hotel for 4 nights during a vacation and loved every aspect of it. From the airport pick-up, to the early check-in, to the very clean room, to the elegant lobby and bar, to the wonderful and quiet terrace and pool area, to the awesome spa, and to the delicious breakfast, everything was top class. The staff was very friendly and helpful with directions around Casablanca. Oh yes, I slept like a baby in the soft bed. Well done!

This hotel was really nice and clean. The people working were also really nice. Unfortunately we went during Ramadan so theready were no activities for us to do. The staff was able to assist me in surprising my husband. Overall it was a really good experience.

Good restaurant and, rare in Morocco, a good full-service bar. Excellent rooms and staff. Well located to other nearby restaurants and, should you need it, a Starbucks. Location easy for the car shuttle services to find.

I HIGHLY recommend this beautiful hotel. I would definitely rate each and every category as a 5*. Property, staff, cuisine, even a spectacular Spa on sight. I could not have felt more welcomed and valued as a guest from each and every staff member on the property. I began my Moroccan trip at this hotel in Casablanca, and will be returning for another 3 nights next month at the close of my holiday. Very much looking forward to it! When I checked out of this hotel only this morning, I booked another Jasmine Spa experience for my return. Thank you so much Le Casablanca hotel. I arrived as a guest, and will return feeling like family. Thank you for that! Another testimony to this establishment is that it was within the last week of Ramadan. No one, except us guests of course, eats‚Ä¶

Le Casablanca far exceeded our expectations. In addition to the beautiful furnishings and top shelf amenities, the staff was over the top. We can‚Äôt say enough about Said, the registration manager who filled the roll of an excellent Concierge. A wonderful experience that we recommend to all.

We stayed at the hotel for 1 night prior to our 1 week adventure tour of Morocco. Absolutely stunning hotel - beautiful gardens and facilities. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly, and we even were upgraded to a Suite free of charge. The hotel is in a great location with lots of amenities within walking distance or a short cab ride. Simply put, it was an absolutely incredible experience - would highly recommend to anyone staying in Casablanca.

column3: Very good hotel in a nice quite neighborhood
column4: Clean and decent hotel, highly recommended. My only gripe is that the front desk would refuse to arrange for a taxi to the airport and will only give you one option, to use the hotel car. The car charges double of what a grand taxi does. The hotel is making enough money from the room and F&B, they should not need to resort to such cheap tactics.

Le Casablanca Hotel has everything and for me that means service, hospitality and cleanliness. The food is excellent, the staff courteous and helpful and a general philosophy throughout that the guests needs are first. I was not feeling well today and not one or two but 4 waiters contributed to my comfort. This is the place to stay if you are fortunate to visit Casablanca. Morocco, itself, is an intoxicating country. There is so much culture to see and the people are warm and friendly.

I have never stayed in a more comfortable bed, my own included -- I should have looked at the brand of the mattress, which was a pillow-top of some sort. The bedding was comfortable too. Nice room, although nothing much "Moroccan" about it, spacious. Excellent restaurant, beautiful bar, lovely and large lobby area. Nice staff. No complaints at all.

I highly recommend it The room was in a very good condition,it was comfortable and well equipped very quiet too .The location was ideal for me, it was very close to everything . And the service was outstanding and also thanks To Mr mohamed cheklaoui cuz he made my vocation easier more than ever.

Everyone was very helpful and fortunately for us spoke good English. The room was clean and the restaurant had attention waiters and good food. A fair priced hotel with a convenient location in Casablanca.

I stayed for 3 nights and it was unbelievable The hotel is pretty new . The lobby was very nice and the staff were very friendly. The bed was so clean and comfortable.The pool and restaurant were great.

Stayed here for a night and wished it was longer. Mehdi served us an outstanding meal at the Brasserie. Coming from NY and traveling extensively, I can truly recommend both the restaurant and the hotel. Food was fabulous. The garden and outdoor pool with terrace are gorgeous. The jacuzzis within the indoor pool a must after a day of touring.

Never thought could be that great... Such superbe rooms in which you can get the comfort you need to have a very good stay,also to mention that the food was awesome and so tasty... Oh, and of course the service that was beyond my expectations, on top of the list Mr M. Cheklaoui that helped my stay to be as good as i wanted to. Be

I concur with many of the good things said about this hotel; however, several parts of our experience left a bad taste in our mouths. First of all, two emails asking about the shuttle from the airport, resulted in no response. We took a taxi for $30. After checking in, I asked about them calling us a taxi for the return to the airport. The manager flat out refused, telling me that it wasn‚Äôt safe. We took the hotel shuttle, which was $65. I don‚Äôt believe safety was his concern, just greed. Upon checking out we were faced with another $60 charge for breakfast for two. As you can see from the TA listing above, it says ‚Äúbreakfast included.‚Äù We paid over $200 for the night, and this additional charge seems excessive. I could not remember where I had gotten the idea that‚Ä¶

We stayed for 2 nights in the Le Casablanca Hotel after three weeks of travel around Morocco. It's not a large hotel but is very well appointed with excellent bar and food service staff. Farouk the bartender was exceptionally attentive as was Hicham, one of the wait staff. The balcony cafe off the main floor is a great place to have an afternoon coffee or lunch. There's also a large pool set in a beautiful garden area. Even though the hotel is situated din the heart of the city, it's amazingly quiet. We enjoyed are staff in the Le Casablanca Hotel very much and especially appreciated the great staff.

We've got very good treatment and personal care during out 2 stays: in March and in April 2019. We enjoyed hotel's restaurant and sports facilities, especially warm pool. We hope to come back in the coming years to enjoy the premises yet again.

Lovely luscious place to begin & end. Fantastic lobby Spacious rooms & wonderful shower. . Most extensive buffet breakfast‚Äî tho at $30 it should be! virrually anything you could want. Greeted by tea & pastires made us feel appreciated. When we left at 4:30 am, they brought us some breads, jams, etc & to go bags Location in business area, but near Paul for pastrues and dinner at Medina. Also ATM close by & Carrefour grocery. Wish I had time to enjoy pool

After a long journey, we were graciously welcomed to Casablanca by all the staff we encountered at this beautiful hotel. Boutaina, at the front desk was a delight in making us comfortable. Other front desk personnel were also helpful but Boutaina‚Äôs smile was a definite ‚Äúice breaker‚Äù. We also loved the free handy cell phone and took it with us into town to use gps. Thank you for your lovely welcime!

La Brassiere Resturant was a comfortable , elegant dining experience...food was superb and served by an outstanding waiter, Mehdi who attended to our every need as well as entertained us... ... for our first night in Morocco we found Mehdi to be informative and charming...

We are in Casablanca for the beginning of a three week tour of Morocco. We had dinner tonight at the restaurant in Le Casablanca Hotel. Our waiter Mehdi was charming. My husband had fish and I had a risotto dish. Both were delicious. We plan to return at the end of our vacation for another enjoyable evening.

There's so much to love about Le Casablanca Hotel. Service is really outstanding all around. Rooms are large with very comfortable beds. It helps to be situated on the side of the building not facing the street -- or bring your ear plugs to dampen the noise. The bathrooms are lovely, with a high pressure shower (be wary of flooding the floor inadvertently however) and absolutely the finest and best, super-huge bath towels that I've ever experienced in a hotel. I especially enjoyed the bar area, extremely well staffed and nice selection of liquors to enjoy at a not-too-expensive price. The fitness room has enough equipment to get the job done, all modern and easy to operate, with a TV available on the main wall. Finally, breakfast was very good, a nice spread and good‚Ä¶

Ah, a nice respite from the hectic pace of Casablanca. The atmosphere was so calm and peaceful. Lots of amenities including a spa, pool and small work out gym. The d√©cor was lovely although the rooms are just a tad on the tired side. The breakfast buffet had lots of choices. The cocktails in the bar were on the expensive side, about $12 each and while some of the drinks have typical names like Manhattan, don't expect the typical drink. I ordered a Manhattan and it was made with something that tasted like what I have had another time called Fireball Cinnamon whiskey. My friend ordered a cognac and what she got was something over ice in a brandy snifter. However, these were minor issues and we found the staff to be very nice and the hotel quiet. Like many hotels in Morocco,‚Ä¶

Le Casablanca was a great location for relaxing and adjusting to jet lag. Nice to walk the area and near a Starbucks as a good alternative to the huge buffet breakfast served at the hotel.We walked from the Corniche and back so got a nice impression of the area.

We stayed here for 1 night on our way to other cities. Nice hotel, nice rooms, nice breakfast and staff is ok as well. I thought the service was a bit slow at the restaurant but otherwise a NICE stay.

I splurged and treated myself to one night here and, although short, my stay at this hotel was delightful. It was incredibly comfortable and clean, with very kind staff. The breakfast was fantastic and I never wanted to leave!

This is a high end hotel with all the amenities you'd expect. Very nicely appointed rooms that were comfortable, clean and spacious. Excellent bar and restaurant. Breakfasts have a good selection. Be careful, however, upon checking out. I experienced the staff telling me their credit card reader was down and I had to pay in local currency necessitating a walk to an ATM a block away. I had reservations about the truth of this, but I have nothing to confirm my suspicions.

Large comfortable and well appointed rooms, excellent service and great food. This property earns and deserves its 5 stars. There is a great market just two blocks away. You might need to take a taxi to get places as it is not as centrally located as others, but it is worth it.

Our guide on our OAT (Overseas Adventure Travel) didn't talk this hotel up at all. It was one of the best places we've ever stayed in. Unfortunately, we only had one night, as we were leaving bright an early for our flights home to the U.S. Room service brought an incredibly fresh continental breakfast to our room at 3:00am. I've had croissants in Paris, New York and other places in the U.S., but none compared to the ones they served us that morning!

Stayed three night at Hotel Casablanca at the beginning of our Morocco trip. More expensive than some others, but well worth the difference. Beautiful hotel with excellent rooms, good restaurant, and attentive staff

column3: Amazing hotel - the Ritz of Morocco
column4: This hotel is fantastic. Unfortunately we only spent one night, which is definitely not enough. We had dinner in the hotel at La Brasserie du Boulevard. Our server was Mehdi. He was extremely professional, knew his wine exceptionally well, and was the best server I‚Äôve ever had. He made the meal five star by just his service alone. He had the chef prepare just for me a spaghetti Bolognese, which was not on the menu and it was exceptional. I‚Äôm not sure I was impressed more with the food, ambience or Mehdi‚Äôs service, but all were outstanding and I would definitely give five stars and can easily compare to the service at the Ritz Carlton.

We stayed 3 nights at this wonderful hotel. Our included breakfast was incredible, both the food and the service of the staff. We get to go back at the end of our trip for one more night! Yea! Check out the great bed!!

We had the most lovely breakfast at the Hotel. Our headwaiter named Mortada was super kind. He made us feel very comfortable. I want to thank him for his wonderful service and manners. We had a lovely time.

I arrived in the late afternoon and left for a late morning flight to Paris after staying at Le Casablanca Hotel. I tried to spend as much time as possible at the hotel since the facilities were superb including a long slow cocktail at the veranda overlooking the outdoor pool and garden.

column3: Excellent place to start out trip to Morocco
column4: We wanted a nice hotel to start our trip in Morocco. This hotel was great and met all our expectations. Staff were friendly and helpful. Location was great ( and safe ) for walking. This is a luxury hotel that met all of our expectations. I would definitely stay here again.

column3: Warm Service from Le Casablanca Hotel
column4: I enjoyed the warm reception and the friendliness of the team. I enjoyed the cosy feeling of the rooms in general. The room was spacious enough. I however expected to have more English titled instructions in addition to french and arabic

A very beautiful hotel, one of the best hotel experiences I had in my life across the globe.Highly recommended, they jusy have it all, with exceptional level of service on all fronts.The only thing missing is the pillows, i recommend the contour type or the medical ones.

column3: Creme de la creme a Casablanca!
column4: Perfect location ambiance cleanliness service - everything you need for your stay in this cool city! Great restaurant and spa, with exercise equipment and outdoor pool! We spent one lovely night here as our OAT tour group prepared to explore Morocco!! Book it!

column3: Well located, great bedding, slow check-in, miles from becoming proper 5-star
column4: Stayed here for 3-nights for our last leg in Morocco. It's located in a poshy suburbs of Casa, and a short stroll to Blvd Al Massira Al Khadra for nice restaurants and shopping (Zara, Massimo Dutti, etc). Great bedding, extremely comfortable, nice clean toilets & shower space. Welcome fruit bowl was provided in the room which was a nice gesture. Now for the not so great news, check-in was slow (took almost half-an-hour when we were the only checking-in). Bags to the room was equally slow and had to chase them up. Holding deposit (2000 MAD) was not released after we left, rang them but to no avail and left with no option to submit a chargeback. Has plenty of work to become a true 5-star luxury hotel.

Could relate to the background given in the website. Very friendly & courteous staff. The information provided by the restaurant staff was accurate and more updated as compared to guides. Would recommend the hotel for sure.

So professional staff and simply luxurious areas.From guys at the reception to the waiters in the restaurants everyone was so polite and nice. You can‚Äôt pass by someone and you don‚Äôt hear at least a ¬´ Bonjour ¬ª with a smile. Just great üåπ Such a wonderful place in Casablanca. And it is really far away from the heavy traffic section üí™üèº

Nice , Cousy hotel, great location and friendly staff. Breakfast is great. Vallay parking staff were helpful and nice.I expected room towards the pool. My wife , daughter and I really enjoyed it. It was short trip but hopefully we‚Äôll come back soon

The hotel was supposed to be smoke free and was not (the bar allows for smoking--and the smoke permeates throughout the rooms). The staff was not transparent about this, and was not helpful overall (service was poor). The location of the hotel is not the best either, as when one opened the windows it was quite noisy (apparently there are bars in the area that are loud). Would not recommend this hotel.

It was our third time in a year... the hotel is awesome in every way...We had tried other hotels in Morocco but this one is a gem... from the cars handlers to the desk staff without forgetting the hotel general staff our stay was PERFECT...!

Attractive lobby but most employees can‚Äôt communicate well in English so if you don‚Äôt speak Arabic or French I would reconsider. Loud lobby and bar area and constant incense smell. Breakfast was great however!

This 5* hotel is not only well located, but also providing an amazing "Art Deco" atmosphere: recently refurbished, this hotel is definitively answering to the expectation of all guests who are looking to be pampered by a very skilled and friendly staff. Rooms are spacious, well decorated and with all the amenities you can expect in a 5* hotel. The Bar is a wonderful place to relax with a musical ambiance every evening. Last but not least, the restaurant "La Brasserie du Boulevard" is proposing a quality French cuisine. Definitively a place to be recommended.

column3: Good Experience, Excellent for the business traveller
column4: Excellent rooms, good reception and service. Good restaurant on the ground floor that played some good music as well. Some work needed on the breakfast offering to make it really worthwhile, as well to have the dining room and staff ready when breakfast actually opens. Excellent concierge service.

column3: very good but needs work to become true 5 stars
column4: I stayed at Le Casablanca for 2 weeks while on a business trip The lobby is well stylish, looking like a 5 start hotel but when you get to the room (mine was 202) you don‚Äôt get that feeling anymore The furniture‚Äôs were old, scratched and they looked like they needed to be changed (especially the 2 chairs in the small table) Small details also that you pay attention to 5 star hotels needs to be taken care, for example the Nespresso capsules were not refueled every day so every afternoon that I was returning to the room I had to ask for the refill When you advertise turn down service twice a day you need to do it all the way, change all towers, refill all amenities and change all used coffee caps and glasses Last but not least I have to mention that staff was very friendly,‚Ä¶

Upon check in the desk had accidentally cancelled our booking. This took half an hour to fix. Ok. Our twin Room was a double which we asked to separate to twins (as booked). 3 hours later after dinner still not done. The electronic key wouldn't work and wow that took half an hour to code. 12.30 pm and I am still waiting for a change of rooms so that a work colleague and I don't have to sleep in the same bed together. Would I return to this hotel. Ha, I'd go to faulty towers instead.

column3: My Name is Nahel Abdel bar ,finance manager ,Regular visit to Casablance ,staying only in this excelent Hotel
column4: Excellent Hotel ,rooms &hospitality Very friendly & excellent hotel staff specially the reception team (Said Sbouli ,Mohamed (both guys) and all other members , really helpful ,nice ,always smile in front of you ,solving any issue to make the guest happy and comfortable . Really enjoying staying in this hotel and always will come and encourage my friends to do so .

It is an extraordinary place. Not only people are nice, friendly, professional and extremely welcoming, but the rooms are very nice, clean and modern without being difficult to understand how to operate things like in some ultra modern ones. The grounds are small but pretty, the staff at the bar very warm and friendly without being intrusive and the people at the front desk extra helpful. Will definitely go back.

The hotel staff and services were great. The room was great. The hammam was incredible. The only thing I would say is that the restaurant here was terrible and their service was very poor. I would absolutely stay here again but would eat elsewhere.

column3: Lovely hotel to visit despite some snagging issues
column4: The hotel is generally very well kept and has beautiful d√©cor. The room was spacious and cool. I had a problem with the plughole in the bathtub that wouldn't drain and had to report it twice before it could be fixed. The night manager said a Plumber could come over at 7am the next morning (a Saturday) and he simply shrugged when I said that wasn't convenient as I was on holiday and didn't want to have to accommodate around the Plumber's availability so early in the morning.I spoke with the day manager the next day and I was immediately 'upgraded' to a different room with a walk-in shower instead of a bath tub. It also had a view over the pool , which was a bit better than the previous room.The breakfast buffet is very good with the treat of an egg station for a bespoke omelette‚Ä¶

Located in an affluent residential area of Casablanca, this is in every possible respect one of the best hotels in the country; Not for the novice, but for the seasoned traveller who knows what s/he is looking for in an hotel. At sunset, by the pool bar, try a Cohiba Siglo VI paired with a Caipirinha...

Reminder that the hotels address on Expedia which is what we used to reserve a room is incorrect so we drove around for a while until realizing the address was bad It's a cozy old Royal style hotel, nice rooms, full service, walking distance to many great restaurants Also the souk is close by For a couple's stay it was a great experience and they offered great service

High- and Lowlights throughout our 3 day stay. Had 2 connecting rooms. All clean and functional. Minibar was included. Service at the bar very slow. Staff seemed to be engaged much more with the POS than with customers. Excellent breakfast, fairly good service. On day 3 server remembered preferences. Had lunch at the balcony restaurant. Food ok, but service failed in every way. Tables not clean, super slow, forgot 2 times order etc. Used the Spa and had a hamam which was excellent. Professional spa therapist. Nice pool.

Stayed here for 3 days with work and what a great find The hotel itself is beautiful with a slightly colonial feel, the restaurant backs onto the pool and garden area which is fantastic Breakfast served outside on a lovely terrace Not the cheapest in the area but worth the extra expense

column3: Very nice lobby and restaurants design
column4: I was impressed by the design of the lobby when I arrived in this boutique hotel. The area is stylish, the bar and restaurant next to it looks almost like a Parisian style 5-star hotel..Very stylish and a real delight to sit down and enjoy your coffee or drink, read a book or meet a business partner. Unfortunately when I came to my room (standard) I felt a bit disappointed as the decor did not match at all what I saw in the lobby.. The red color in the room feels aggressive and not calming after a day out in the city. Even if the hotel meant to repeat some art deco style this has not been the best result in my opinion. The bathroom was small but nice, the bed very comfortable, but the furniture had nothing of the 5-star feeling I got when I entered the hotel. If I should stay‚Ä¶

column3: Absolutely Beautiful Hotel With Questionable Staff
column4: We were only planning to stay in Casablanca for one night, so we decided to get one of the best rooms on the property (Royal Suite), which we booked well in advance and received confirmation of such prior to our arrival. Upon arrival to the hotel, our passports were requested and even though he had the"head traveler's" (mine) passport, the front desk employee proceeded to ask if we had 2 rooms. That did not sit well with me because he did not even taken the opportunity to look at the reservation and made an assumption. Upon return after a quick couple of hours of sightseeing and eating, we decided that we would sit by the pool for the reminder of the evening - this was the highlight of our stay and quite frankly what saved this review from being much lower. Our server was‚Ä¶

The best staff you'll have anywhere, comfy beds and the feeling of luxury is all I could ask for and this hotel delivers on all those fronts. I'd go back anytime I'm in Casablanca and also recommend La Brasserie du Boulevard right next to it if you decide to visit!

Stayed in Le Casablanca hotel just for one night during my transit in Casablanca, retro boutique hotel, reminded me a bit to The Beaumont hotel London, impressive Cool lobby, very clean sizable rooms, comfortable beds, cool guest and nice hotel for Casablanca standard, you can empty the mini bar for free, I would definitely recommend it and one of the nicest hotels in Casablanca.

Its is a charming, colonial style hotel with all needed amenities in the room. Charming garden and pool area. It is located in a very calm neighborhood yet less than 10 mn walk from city center. Staff are very nice and helpful.

I stayed at this hotel twice in the past 2 months. The first time was for 10 days; the second for 12 days. The first time, I observed so much misbehavior from the staff and I still chose not to complain for the only reason: the perfect location of the hotel. The second time, it was an absolute nightmare and I am not exagerating. I had my brother and his wife (we presented all necessary documentation at the reception) who wanted to come up with me for 5 mins- just the time to change my clothes. The refused to let them in. At a later stage, they called security to stop us at the elevator. I asked to see the "manager" who also refused. They said I had to pay for it. The debate took more than an hour.. the most unprofessional attitude ever! I really would like someone to contact‚Ä¶

The air conditioner was not working, there was a leak in the ceiling which caused me to slip in fall, and my breakfast came 3 hours after requested. Can provide pictures of leak if requested. Regards, Mo

Le Casablanca hotel is quite nice with a beautiful garden and pool. Nice staff but service could have been improved. We did make a complaint and felt that service picked up. Rooms are spacious. Location is nice. Would go back!

column3: Very good hotel, great staff, reliable service, nice green garden, great spa, only a bit overpriced!
column4: Spent a week at a 2nd floor garden view room. Very spacious and comfortable, free water, coffee, tea. Good room service. Hotel close to a gourmet Carrefour nearby for Organic food and items of purchase, close to the center but quiet at the garden side. Slow , very slow internet... the pool and spa is nice. Hammam scrub highly recommended.

From the moment one arrives the service makes you feel welcome. The hotel is decorated in Art Deco in good taste. It is very beautiful. The clients are treated with respect and it is ideal to meet for business. There is an outside Pool in a pretty garden as well as a heated pool indoors. The restaurants have interesting menus well executed. The bedrooms are confortable and luxurious. Would definitely return.

We stayed 3 night in this hotel, almost it feels like a business hotel, rooms are comfortable and staff has good behavior. I liked the breakfast and dinner that we had in our room was very delicious and served very good. Indoor swimming pool was cold in that time so we couldn‚Äôt enjoy it! Hotel has good location in city . I recommend this hotel for business trips.

Very nice hotel that we stayed in. Excellent service although on occasion was alittle hurried but not in a bad way as advised it was a new hotel so they are still getting used to perhaps the European way of "when your ready". Rooms were great with the most amazing and comfortable bed ever. The black out curtains certainly allow you to sleep well. Would have been great if had their own transport service as use local petite taxis which are ok but when you are dressed to go somewhere chic...alittle shabby. Overall would definitely go again.

I enjoyed a great stay at the Casablanca hotel. I appreciated in particular the friendly and very customer oriented style of Casablanca‚Äòs staff. Excellent food - the beef i can only recommend; breakfast very nice. Good wines. Rooms good very comfortable bed. I will positively come back during my next business trip to Casablanca

column3: Not as good as it looks
column4: Fantastic looking hotel. The food and bar are brilliant along with the pool area. The negatives are the rooms are tidy but NOT clean there are finger prints on all the high gloss doors and surfaces. The comunial toilets the same. Take lots of cash as every car or extra you ask for even the transport to the airport you have to pay for. This could be an amazing hotel but it lacks many things that a five star hotel would provide. A massive positive are the beds are so comfortable you will not want to leave,

this hotel is always a sure destination if you want to stay in a nice and comfortable hotel in Casablanca. the room is nice, very clean and comfortable . the location is perfect and quite . the spa and gym are ok and also the restaurant is very very good. one must have is the breakfast !! I definitevely suggest to stay at this hotl if you have a chance to be in casablanca

Le Casablanca hotel has been simply perfect. Very comfortable rooms, very kind personnel, very beautiful ambient. I liked very much also the breakfast buffet and the SPA center with the swimming which are the perfect place where to relax and enjoy the beauty treatments.

Since our check-in process I could notice the poor service of the reception‚Ä¶ Mr Said does not have enough experience e kindness to deal with guests! It seemed that he was doing a favor for us... During checkin process we were offered a welcome drink without asking anything and after about 15 minutes nobody came to attend us... I had to remind him and other two waiters! After that we were served with 3 single teas e 4 small pieces of pastries! Then I went to talk to the Manager about the bad treatment we had so far it seemed that the things would get better. Due to the problem He offered us a dinner that was great! we‚Äôve being attended by Mr Salim who was very kind all the time. Next day, we have to ask for a hair dryer twice to the reception and even saying that there was not‚Ä¶

We loved the old school charm and glamour of the hotel. The room was large and clean. Clarins products in the bathroom! I wish we had more time to spend in the hotel but we were only in Casablanca one evening. Staff were very friendly but don't rely on them for tourist advice - we were told categorically that there were no guided tours for the mosque, which is not true. Do note that the hotel is a little way out of town and we struggled to get taxi drivers who knew it (there is a 3 star Casablanca hotel in town) or who wanted to go there. We ended up walking back to the hotel (about 3km) which was would have been pleasant if I hadn't been warned that Casablanca was not a safe place to walk around at night!

column3: One of the best hotels I‚Äôve ever been to.
column4: This was my second time visiting the hotel. Each time Casablanca hotel does not fail to impress me!!!! Everyone is very nice and helpful. The hotel it self is very luxurious the smell in the hotel is just wonderful couldn‚Äôt get enough of it. But what really did it for me was the bedding!!! It felt like I slept on a cloud!!! Best night sleep in my life and that‚Äôs no exag√©ration. Love love love

I have always stayed at the Hotel Hyatt when visiting Casablanca but we were recommended to stay this time at the Hotel Casablanca.... big mistake. It is not near the centre but in a superb all be it an affluent one. It‚Äôs dull and ordinary with mediocre service. If you are looking for a hotel in Casablanca with a decent business centre and reliable service go to the Hyatt, I know I will return there on my next visit.

Art Deco styled hotel near the centre of town with walled garden at the rear. Old world feel with friendly and efficient staff. The resl gem is the restaurant where the food is first class, way above expectation and an absolute delight.

We met our daughter and son-in-law at Le Casablanca hotel for a weekend. The hotel is very splendid. The lobby is one of the most beautiful I have ever seen - very lush and stunning. Hotel reception very helpful. Our room was comfortable and decorated in great taste. The bed was so comfortable, I could have stayed there all day. The hotel has an outside pool and loungers/parasols around it. We spent one day there and no-one came near or by. I wondered where towels were if I had wanted to swim! Little niggles, though. The aircon never worked although every day an engineer was sent to repair it. It was either off or blowing out cold air when the temperature was set at 35 degrees. The phones in the room didn't work properly either. The hotel were very good at sending‚Ä¶

Very welcoming Lobby/ Reception area. Welcoming refreshments of drinks and biscuits were provided. Our room was very large and beautifully appointed. The bed was extremely comfortable. The Concierge called within a few minutes of checking in to enquire if everything was to our satisfaction and providing us with complimentary use of the Min Bar was a very nice touch. My wife visited the Spa and purchased a number of products and advised me that the staff were very helpful and that it looked most inviting. The Bar area is very comfortable with live entertainment on the Piano. The hotel has an indoor and outdoor pool which is great with such a variable climate. Can‚Äôt wait to stay again !

Best hotel in Casablanca, best services ever. Rooms are done twice a day, Breakfast is awesome, cleanliness at top, close to all amenities in Casablanca. Le meilleur hotel luxe de Casablanca, Decors luxueux, literie magique, service et amabilite du personnel parfaits, cadre sobre et unique. Worth the visit.

Perfect Hotel, including staff service (Said en Mohammed) was very friendly and always ready to help. The room is clean, the facilities in the room are good. But, breakfast was not so excellent, more France and less halal! We will definitely come back to this hotel.

column3: Old World Charm in a New Hotel!
column4: My stay was split between the Four Seasons and this hotel and Le Hotel Casablanca was better by far! First of all it is in a nicer area, within walking distance of restaurants and stores. The front desk was a little standoffish to Americans (some staff doesn't speak English) but that's OK. The service was impeccable. The hotel houses several restaurants, all were delicious at prices that won't break the bank. The pool area was marvelous, although that water was COLD in November! The lobby was beautiful and we stayed in a gorgeous suite. Highly recommended.

Cannot believe security chased me to the car of my friend parked in front of hotel..telling me i have to keep my bag inside till i pay! The room was also booked via an invoice order! Aircon stopped working 2 times in 3 days

It was a nice stay. The hotel is new and very nicely decorated. The staff are kind and helpful although most of the time they don‚Äôt speak English. The SPA was very good, very clean and good quality service. I recommend

I have been to the le Casablanca hotel lately for a business meeting that I had arranged there. I want to compliment all the people running this hotel, for the great service presented. A high standard of professionalism, whether with the people I dealt with for the meeting itself, or the whole stay. The rooms are of a good size, the amenities also in the hotel are of a high standard. My only regret is that the room I was staying in is starting to show signs of use, but I am sure this will be remedied for. All in all an excellent stay and I will choose this hotel again for my next visit to Morocco soon.

This my second stay at the hotel the location is very good for business trips , it is quite the rooms are clean and cozy , the indoor pool is an add on to this place I had a smooth check in Room service has improved I got.my shirts cleaned and ironed in 3 hours Staff did significant progress Special thanks to the morning team for the professionalism.

column3: Beautiful hotel but not so great restaurant staff
column4: My husband and I stayed at Le Casablanca Hotel for one night and thought it was absolutely stunning. The room was large and the bed was so comfortable. However, we were very disappointed by the staff at the restaurant. My husband and I wanted a quick bite to eat for dinner and were basically escorted without words to a table....that wasn't clean. The table still had wine glasses and utensils from the previous guests. Normally, I wouldn't mind but there were several clean tables around us. We ignored the mess and waited to be greeted by a server. However, NOBODY acknowledged us for about 15 minutes! Two staff members walked by during that 15 minute time period but we were basically invisible. I wanted to walk out and leave (not that anyone would notice) but ended up staying. Food‚Ä¶

column3: Great hotel let down by poor service
column4: I stayed on business to attend a conference with 3 colleagues, the hotel has all the right touches to make it a first class experience. The rooms are large and very well appointed. Beds are fantastic and with great linens. Bathroom is top notch with a huge sink, separate toilet, great bath with plenty of storage room. Mini was complimentary as was fruit. A kettle with tea and coffee also provided. The food in the hotel is delicious the only issue is getting served. Lots of staff are stood around but getting attention requires commitment from the guest. Then 50 mins for 2 G&Ts ...a glass of wine was a further 15 mins and we had almost finished our dinner before it was served. This was the standard for each of the 5 nights we were there. Very disappointing. Some serious‚Ä¶

Just came back from a lovely 2 night stay at Le Casablanca Hotel. The room was very large, modern and clean. The bed was extremely comfortable and the sweets & inclusive drinks in the Junior suite was a lovely touch. Breakfast was delicious, staff were all very friendly and the swimming pool area was very relaxing and well maintained. I will definitely be staying here again!

Very lovely hotel - decor is great, art deco which i love. Bedrooms are great, big, spacious and high quality fixtures and fittings. Sadly let down by quite shambolic service ....... Breakfast service was like a car crash every morning - I needed to be there for when it opens (7am ...... not early enough) and every day nothing was really ready. Over 3 mornings no one asked me if i wanted any drinks, i had to go to the counter to ask. No one on duty to greet the guests, no one there to say goodbye, most light in corridors turned off so it is diffuctl to find anyway. And others things - only one lift woking over the whole week, and the other one was a bit intermittent, Bar service inthe evening is hit and miss - lots of staff standing aorund but no one serving. So‚Ä¶

Absolutely incredible stay at Le Casablanca Hotel. Everything was perfect from the moment we arrived. The service is amazing, the staff are so helpful and can't do enough for you. The food is to die for and the drinks list is impressive. We also had a day in the spa and that was amazing! So relaxing! The pool and pool bar is a perfect way to spend the afternoon! Thank you so much for making our honeymoon so incredibly special.

I booked this hotel for one Night. The location of this cozy hotel is perfect and the service is was good. But the staff of the valet parking was weird. On arrival I left the keys of my car at the valet. One of the employee who parked my came to me in the lobby and said: "I parked your car safely". I was confused lol, but I thanked him friendly. By checking out the same employee came to me and said: " I brought your car"! He repeated it twice?! An other colleague said something to me but I haven't heard what he said. This guy answered him and told him to shut up because he was talking to me. I started to laugh. But what he indirectly was asking is money for his service. I only gave a tip to the guy who put the luggage in my car.

I and my wife have spend a nice week-end in this luxurious Hotel, room was very comfortable, even if I was a bit noisy from the main road-side. Wonderful lobby, Very nice garden with an awesome swimming-pool. Breakfast quality needs improvement, some fruits on the buffet were not fresh !!!! Services in general were professional.

This is a wonderful hotel with a great relaxing atmosphere. The food and breakfast was amazing. The were 2 negatives the first service was some times slow and staff not attentive enough to our needs. The second was the language barrier and this could also apply to my 1st negative. We don't speak French or Arabic and the staffs English was weak, this was made up by Mohamed at the reception desk who was there to translate our needs at all times. We were also approached by the manager Amin who acknowledged on the changes required and they were being implemented in the near future. Due to your insurety for future plans and thank you to Mohamed. You made it a 5 star stay.

column3: Wonderful hotel with all the amenities
column4: Had a very relaxing stay at Le Casablanca Hotel. There is both an indoor and outdoor pool with a poolside bar. The overall design is elegant and upscale. The rooms are very comfortable and quiet. There is also a spa and a Starbucks a few minutes down the street by walking.

spa was really great and treatment was superb the air condition in the room was positioned at bed exactly which was not good at all also pillows were not so good staff at check in was not so quick but generally was a good experience

We very much liked this newly renovated grand hotel, in colonial style, with fantastic patio and a beautiful garden with lush swimming pool. Excellent bedding in the room, a bit to much red/purple accents though. Luxury bathroom. This is a great addition to the Casablanca high-end hotel market.

My wife and I stopped in Casablanca in our way to West Africa and decided to stay in a nice place for two nights. We couldn't have choose better. After a warm reception by Said despite our late arrival, we went straight to the room, that was just wonderful, wide and comfortable, with a huge bed a bit too soft for my taste. The staff is wonderful there, very kind and helpful, and the swimming pool is the place to relax yourself. Breakfast is outstanding and we even had dinner one night, nice snack food (especially the tomato salad and the burger) in a very romantic atmosphere. I really enjoy staying there and can't thank enough Said for make things as smooth as possible to us.

column3: a wonderfull place ruined by unskilled staff
column4: I was not sure about my section for this hotel as im a frequent flyer to Morocco and a I usually stay for not less than 10 days for business I tried most of Casablanca hotels ,so if you are planning for long stay you should consider the following points 1- the hotel decorations and lobby is extremely elegant . 2- Room with good size and well furnished ,(however not al tv channels works + working desk is relatively small) . 3- Hotel location is very good and near to the new downtown 4- swimming pool is very nice (but I don't understand why you are working on the floor maintenance over the week end when most of the guests were looking for relaxation) on the other hand the pool was closed for maintenance (this is normal) 5 - breakfast is very nice ,and in dinning is very classy‚Ä¶

column3: Flamboyant luxury that Footballers' Wives would adore
column4: To Casablanca for a few days work. Le Casablanca hotel is the relatively- new, chic spot in town for affluent locals and small business conferences. Located on a central road with a few western premium brand boutiques, and some local restaurants of varying degrees of smartness within walking distance. Whilst you couldn't describe the luxury as, er, exactly understated, it's comfortable, airy and spacious. Plenty of public areas for lounging and meeting, a good pool and a ( pretty small) gym room. Eating and drinking options indoors and out and a well-stocked, √ºberglitzy lobby bar. Bed was very comfortable with a good - sized bathroom with wide bath, Clarins toiletries. Don't rely on ease of the free wifi connection, or much reliable continuity.... Nespresso coffee‚Ä¶

In July on Business Trip I decided to stay at this hotel. It's a perfect business hotel elegant lobby, courteous and professional staff and well appointed specious rooms. Location is great in a nice area close to Business district and nice resturants.

Ok! I wasn't sure about my choice at the beginning but when I came in and met the receptionist ASMA, everything changed. She is amazing very friendly and professional. The hotel is very sophisticated, clean and comfy. I would stay there again on my next visit. Thanks for hiring such wonderful people like Asma. A typical welcomy moroccan girl!

A new hotel, in a quiet location. I liked the luxurious style of the bar. A beautiful mix between modern and baroque. The room was just perfect with a very very confortable bed. A various breakfast and a delicious dinner. The staff was welcoming, attentive, efficient. The perfect persons in a perfect place :)

column3: Our new place to be in Morocco
column4: It's a new hotel, so everything is still in good shape. The staff is efficient, helpful, welcoming, and quick. Bedroom is spacious. Excellent location, very near Starbucks Breakfast is ok, variety tends towards the limited side but the quality of the food is good. Looking forward to the next trip and stay there.

A wonderfull place in Casablanca. Nice rooms. Nice h√¥tel staff. Wonderfull restaurant and lovely Piano Bar. Since february I have found this New place in Casablanca with √† lot of quality features. A sp√©cial note to the Brasserie restaurant and is Chief ICHAM.

This place just opened three months ago.. It is simply magical as if you are back in the 30th We stayed at Casablanca four-season's in our way in to Moroco and it was dead boring . Don't think twice this is the place to be great value for money amazing food and beautiful people

We tried the "Boat suite"... It was just magic. Clearly to be discovered, very well located, excellent food and service, great swimming pool (outside and Inside), spa and bar/restaurants... Just perfect !
